Do you see that pile of chrome over there? No? Neither do I. Because the machine was VAPORIZED! Good that you gave me 2 singularities, the first one... Well... Just get me a better casing, would you?

It seems, that the stabilizers need... stabilizing... But I'm out of field generators. Can you help me with this?

pages:9.8:
Conceptual Device:
The Zero-Point-Module.

Hello my friend.
I need you to help me with a pr

betterquesting.name: Hello there
betterquesting.desc: I've observed your pathway, and I have to say, I'm impressed. I might need your help soon, on a big project of mine.

betterquesting.name: Power. So much power!
betterquesting.desc: If only I could harness it... Well, hi there my friend. I need your help with a project of mine. I want to create an immense power source, but I have a few problems that I need to solve first. Will you help me? You will be rewarded.

betterquesting.name: A problem that matters
betterquesting.desc:
I need to open a wormhole. But for that, I need an immense gravitational field. One like those created upon the death of a star. But I can't really "kill" a sun for this. I need to compress matter somehow... 
But... How?

betterquesting.name: Now that matters!
betterquesting.desc: Of course! The matter condenser! How come I didn't think of that?

betterquesting.name: I need a stabilizer
betterquesting.desc: Opening the wormhole is one thing, but I need to stabilize it, so it doesn't harm anything. I guess I need something made of crystal. Why? Because I like it fancy. Find me a crystal-based, transparent material with immense power, would you?

betterquesting.name: Shiny!
betterquesting.desc: What in the world is this? This is amazing! I need more of these! They will be an amazing containment material for the wormhole!

betterquesting.name: I'm hungry
betterquesting.desc: What... I work a lot! So get me some food please.

betterquesting.name: It needs a power plug...
betterquesting.desc: Given the fact that I will be able to craft this device, it needs some kind of "plug" to get the power out. I need something to conduct immense amounts of power. I thought about superconductors, but they don't fit with the crystal casing material I have in mind. I need 2 different crystals, one for positive and one for negative charge.

betterquesting.name: Red and blue
betterquesting.desc: Really? A red and blue crystal? How awesome is that! I think I will need 8 of each color, just to be sure.

betterquesting.name: A casing
betterquesting.desc: I need something for the outer shell. Again, a crystal-based material would be best, because I like it shiny. I tested all crystals we know and none of them meet the requirements. I heard you have access to the space? Can you try to find a suitable material while you're out there?

betterquesting.name: Fancy!
betterquesting.desc: Yes. Yes! That's it! Bring me more of this stuff! I probably need a lot of it...

betterquesting.name: Beyond imagination
betterquesting.desc: What is this? Draconium dust? I wonder if I could use this for something...

betterquesting.name: The power of dragons
betterquesting.desc:
Hey my friend. I got your sample, and I have to say, I'm amazed. This material has a lot of potential, but it's useless at the moment. I have an idea how to turn this into something useful, but I need you to help me with a few problems first.

I need a good handful of that stuff for my research. Please get me some.

betterquesting.name: A hull
betterquesting.desc: First things first, we need a hull. I played around with your sample, and it seems that it reacts with every known material. It even attacks Iridium! It's completely harmless if it's in a box that is open, but as soon as I try to enclose it in something, poof. It breaks free. We need something stronger than iridium my friend.

betterquesting.name: Dense, denser, Neutronium
betterquesting.desc:
Now look at this. This stuff is incredibly dense. Maybe this material will be sufficiently strong?

This looks promising. Send me some samples, and I will try my luck.

betterquesting.name: Not a planet
betterquesting.desc: This place is interesting. Maybe I should try to find new materials here...

betterquesting.name: Successful.. Or not?
betterquesting.desc:
Heh, neutronium. I didn't even know such a thing really exists. Unfortunately, the draconium dust was enclosed for... 5 seconds? But, it was a small success. 

Ok let's travel to some planets and moons and look for the new material. I think we have to fly very far away for it.

betterquesting.name: Black Plutonium
betterquesting.desc:
This doesn't seem to be dense, but it's a material you haven't seen before. Maybe this could be the solution?

Black what? Huh, interesting. Send me some samples, I want to analyse it.

betterquesting.name: We have a hull
betterquesting.desc: Surprisingly, this material is able to contain the draconium dust. It could be the radiation. Good job my friend!

Lore:9.8: The first sample. Wait.. Is that... a button?

betterquesting.name: Draconium Dust core
betterquesting.desc: I've created a first sample of what I shall call "Draconium Dust core". Not quite the result I expected to be honest, but see for yourself.

Lore:9.8: The first sample. Wait.. Is that... a button?

betterquesting.name: We need to control it
betterquesting.desc: The problem is, that the immense power of this dust is released all at once. We need something to control the vast amount of energies. I noticed that the dust starts to glow when it gets near an aura node. Maybe Thaumaturgy has the solution?

betterquesting.name: The power of primals
betterquesting.desc: What else could control energies better than a focus of crystallized primal energy? With this little item, it should be possible to control the energies released from the dust.

betterquesting.name: Unforeseen consequences
betterquesting.desc: You haven't heard anything in a while from the technician. You have a feeling that something might have gone terrible wrong, so you went to his place to investigate. What you found was... nothing. A void. It seems that he tried to combine the pearl with the dust. What did he say? The dust reacts to aura nodes? Of course it does. It amplifies the energies by a thousand times. And giving it raw primal energy, good lord, what has he done. May he rest in peace...

betterquesting.name: I'm on my own now
betterquesting.desc: I need to continue my research. I still think that this primordial pearl is the key to control the dust, but I'm not sure how. Maybe the pearl is just too strong? I should try to use something that's similar, but less powerful. It reacts to vis, so maybe.. I should try to make a wand focus with that pearl. That way, I could channel vis into the dust without actually combining both.

betterquesting.name: An interesting material
betterquesting.desc: This metal has quite interesting properties. It seems, that it has absorbed some of the energy that exists in the End. While ender pearls are quite fragile, this metal is a lot more durable. However, the absorbed energy is not enough to teleport things around. But you might find a solution for this.

betterquesting.name: Gross, what is that...
betterquesting.desc: It's purple, and it smells like rotten eggs. But while staring at this unpleasant fluid, you had an idea. You can't reach the dust directly, but can you actually teleport something in and out the field? Might be worth a try.

betterquesting.name: An appropriate focus
betterquesting.desc: You've tried a lot, and nothing was quite enough to activate the dust. Until now. You finally found a focus that is able to transmit enough power to cause a heavy reaction with the dust, but not enough to cause problems.

betterquesting.name: Activated draconium dust
betterquesting.desc: At least for a short period of time. The wand focus is powerful enough to activate the dust, but it will convert back to regular dust as soon as I stop feeding it with vis. If I only could contain it, surround it with a forcefield...

Lore:9.8: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

betterquesting.name: The strongest forcefield
betterquesting.desc: In order to create a forcefield, I need to build myself a containment device. I will use only the best emitters I can afford. I will take no risks here.

Lore:9.8: used to be a machine hull

betterquesting.name: Not what I expected...
betterquesting.desc: The outcome was... interesting. It did not explode, instead, the activated draconium dust generated a counter-field to mine! Unfortunately, the emitters could not stand the reverse energies, and melted. I was able to shut it off quick enough to save the machine casing (At least what's left from it...) And a couple of field generators.

Lore:9.8: used to be a machine hull

betterquesting.name: Forcefield, second try
betterquesting.desc: I came to the following conclusion: Draconium dust seems to react nicely with all kinds of magic energy, and seems to repel technology. So I need to find a way to create a forcefield with magic alone. There must be a way...

betterquesting.name: A magic force field
betterquesting.desc:
While node stabilizers are too weak, you found a way to generate a strong containment field, generated by magic itself. You tried to use warded glass, but even the "frozen in spacetime" material could not resist the power of activated draconium dust. You decided to build another device, this time with your newest invention.

The vortex attenuator is powerful enough to negate even hungry nodes, and it also will be able to contain activated draconium dust.

Just to be sure, I will add some amplifiers to it.

betterquesting.name: What the...?
betterquesting.desc: The device works! It is able to fully contain and separate the draconium dust from everything around it! Unfortunately... It also prevents the vis from passing the barrier, which results in regular draconium dust... In a forcefield...

Lore:9.8: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

betterquesting.name: Looking for alternatives
betterquesting.desc:
It is frustrating. Either you are able to contain the dust but can't activate it, or, you activate it and it causes serious damage. Maybe you need to find answers somewhere else.

Draconic... Like... Dragon?

betterquesting.name: Draconic... Like... Dragon?
betterquesting.desc: Maybe you where looking for the right things in the wrong place. As this dust obviously origins from dragons, the best thing to do now is to find answers in the dimension of dragons: The End.

betterquesting.name: Weird creatures
betterquesting.desc: These ghosts are weird beings. But, I found this ectoplasm, which, by itself, seems to be pretty useless.

betterquesting.name: Activated teleport power
betterquesting.desc: By a random guess of yours, you combined molten ender pearls and a few more of these shards with an empty gem, and it turned blue. It is pulsating with power. You tried to use it on your containment device, and it seems to be able to bypass the force field, while keeping it intact that the same time. Sadly, it doesn't have enough power to let vis pass through. Maybe you can even further increase the gems power?

betterquesting.name: Arcane shards
betterquesting.desc: While the normal world is based on vis and primal energy, the End seems to be quite different. This arcane shard is the crystallized form of this energy, just like the primal shards that you used so many times in the past. By pure randomness, you discovered that it reacts with the metal you've found.

Lore:9.8: In good memory of your old friend, the technician. May he rest in peace

betterquesting.name: Draconic evolution
betterquesting.desc: Don't you hate it to manually compress all those tiny piles? Let's automate this process! A combination of a typefilter, a chest buffer (super buffer in HV) and a packager frees you from that annoying task. The chestbuffer can hold up to 9 tiny piles and the super buffer can hold all your tiny dusts and you can set its mode with a screwdriver on the output side. Set it to 9 and let the packager handle the rest.

Lore:9.8: In good memory of your old friend, the technician. May he rest in peace

betterquesting.name: Balanced thaumium
betterquesting.desc: This new metal is quite cheap, and has an awesome conductivity towards all 6 primal aspects. Regarding the capsule, I'd say it is a superconductor for vis. I think I can finally assemble the final frame.

betterquesting.name: Automated evolution
betterquesting.desc:
The machine is working pretty well, but it's tedious to fill in the reagents manually. But you have an idea, you could use a few basic components to fully automate the process.

You can use robot arms and conveyor belts to automate the input and output.

Obviously, you need to power the machines. A solar panel will do just fine.

In order to automate the catalyst, you need a few things. One golem will gather basic materials, while the second one will hunt creepers and ghasts for the more valuable ingredients.

You found a way to re-use the singularity, so you only need to get some sand. Luckily, the golem that works on the catalyst will be able to get glass too. He just needs a little additional motivation.

Your golems need light, obviously. Also, it would be nice if there are some signal lamps that indicate the status of the process. Would it not?

betterquesting.name: Activated teleport gem
betterquesting.desc: You are sure that you've just discovered the solution for your containment problem. This gem happily transmits vis on request, while keeping the containment field intact. What a great day!

Lore:9.8: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

betterquesting.name: You did it! But...
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you are able to contain the activated draconium dust for an infinite amount of time, you where able to assure the energy it releases. The readings are incredible. You have never seen such a power before. The only problem is, the machinery required to keep the dust in this state is too large to use it for crafting.

You noticed something that might help: The dust reacts to vis, but it needs a lot of it, therefore you require the animation focus. If you could find a catalyst, that you can mix the dust with, you could make the dust react with the vis from its surroundings instead of a direct beam.

Lore:9.8: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

betterquesting.name: A catalyst
betterquesting.desc:
That's it. This catalyst contains all primal energies in a quite different form, a lot weaker than any node. However, in combination with the draconium dust, it amplifies the vis that's around it, which leads to a permanent activation. It still needs to be contained, but you don't need the direct vis beam any more.

The result is a compound, which still emits massive amounts of power, but is less destructive. It still attacks the neutronium, but I think if I can find a capsule-like container that has special properties, I could create a portable version of it.

betterquesting.name: Bulma would be proud
betterquesting.desc:
By combining a dimensional singularity with some glass cylinders and molten gold, I was able to create a miniature containment field within a very small area. Interesting enough, the new draconium blend amplifies the containment field from the inside. Once I fill the blend in the capsule, it immediately "seals" itself. I won't be able to remove or replace the dust any more, but I don't think I have to...


The perfect vessel for massive power!

betterquesting.name: The final steps
betterquesting.desc: Now that I've found a way to stabilize the draconium dust and keep it safe in a small capsule, I just need to make a small container for it, so I can drain the energy on demand. Neutronium will serve very well, but I need a magic conductor. Thaumium works, but gets way too hot and void metal has a bad conductivity. I need to find a magic alloy that is more "balanced" in terms of primal aspects

betterquesting.name: Endless evolution
betterquesting.desc: Using your machine, you can now craft infinite amounts of these cores. And since it would be gruesome to let your golem work just for one single core, you decided to only request cores in a large batch of 16. How nice of you.

betterquesting.name: Kill Baba Yaga
betterquesting.desc: Baba Yaga is a witch (or one of a trio of sisters of the same name), who appears as a deformed and/or ferocious-looking elderly woman. She flies around in a mortar and wields a pestle. She dwells deep in the forest, in a hut usually described as standing on chicken legs, with a fence decorated with human skulls. Baba Yaga may help or hinder those that encounter or seek her out.

betterquesting.name: Kill Horned Huntsman
betterquesting.desc: A Horned Huntsman is a member of the Wild Hunt, a powerful entity created by the Horned God. If one is encountered, prepare for a hard fight, or better flee.

betterquesting.name: Kill Ender Dragon
betterquesting.desc: The dragon must die. Long enough he destroyed those precious endstone blocks!

betterquesting.name: Kill Shade of Leonard
betterquesting.desc: Leonard is the demonic being who is rumored to have taught a cadre of German witches their trade, and often presided over their sabbats. A skilled coven with the witches cauldron can summon a Shade of the Demon according to the method described in the Witches' Brews book.

betterquesting.name: Kill Lord of Tormentum
betterquesting.desc: A Lord of Torment is a mighty demonic being that is able to create prisons to torment its victims. Those foolish enough to summon one of these creatures must prepare for an arduous fight.

betterquesting.name: Kill Mog and Gulg
betterquesting.desc: Mog and Gulg are the god-like beings that hobgoblins worship. They may send their avatars to pay witches a visit who exploit their worship (with a statue of hobgoblin patron). Rumor has it that using a nether star may make them take immediate notice.

betterquesting.name: Kill Demon
betterquesting.desc: Demons are powerful, evil beings who dwell in the infernal dimensions. To date, none have been seen roaming the Nether, where their minions: ghasts, blazes and their ilk seem to dominate. To meet a demon without a way to protect oneself is almost certain death. They are known to hit like a proverbial truck, and require a significant amount of damage to kill. Some demons have even been seen shooting fireballs! They are, of course, also immune to fire.

betterquesting.name: The power of infinity
betterquesting.desc: You've mastered everything possible. And now it's time to give your equipment the final boost. The infinity egg is just the right addition to your altar. It's quite expensive, but well worth the cost.

betterquesting.name: Lava for blood
betterquesting.desc: Well, both are red, so that connection was quite obvious... Was it...?

betterquesting.name: Tier 1 slates
betterquesting.desc: The basic slates. Basically just stone with blood infused in it.

betterquesting.name: See all the things
betterquesting.desc: It's quite difficult to see how much blood there is in your altar, or your personal blood network. This little device will solve that problem for you. Just a little prick in the finger, and everything will be revealed.

betterquesting.name: Basic rune
betterquesting.desc:
The basic rune that you can craft at this moment.

You need  8 runes for your tier 2 altar, which can hold more blood, and you can make new recipes now.

betterquesting.name: Alchemy with blood
betterquesting.desc: Not like "blood alchemy". You probably will need more than one later, but for now one is sufficient.

betterquesting.name: Potion catalysts
betterquesting.desc: In order to manipulate potions you need catalysts. You then combine the ingredient you used to get the potion effect in with either a lengthening or power catalyst to increase the duration or the strength of the potion effect.

betterquesting.name: Simple alchemical things
betterquesting.desc: Alchemy can be weird, and tedious. There are a lot of reagents and even more possible combinations. For now, and in order to get started, you need a couple of basic things.

betterquesting.name: Refilling your potions
betterquesting.desc: If empty, you don't have to throw the potion away. Just refill it.

betterquesting.name: Special potion flasks
betterquesting.desc: Regular glass phials are unable to hold these special potions you want. You need to imbue them with some blood from your altar.

betterquesting.name: Potion: Flight mode
betterquesting.desc: Just to give you an idea what is possible. Let's do a sample potion. Shall we? Get yourself a potion flask, a feather and one of your weak binding agents you made. Combine those in the chemistry set, and you'll get something that you'll probably want to keep for a while.

betterquesting.name: Simple, but powerful spells
betterquesting.desc: The simple spell system is rather easy to setup, and can be done early on in your bloodmagic career.

betterquesting.name: Paradigm
betterquesting.desc: Paradigms shape your spell.

betterquesting.name: Spell foci
betterquesting.desc: You have nine basic elements and each have a focus, an item that represents them. You place this focus in your altar next to the spell table in order for your magic to flow through it and the paradigm.

betterquesting.name: Some examples
betterquesting.desc: There are a LOT of spell combinations to discover, so just use trial and error!

betterquesting.name: Convenient slate
betterquesting.desc: Collecting items while mining or chopping wood is always tedious. But no more! With this fancy little thing items will just fly towards you! And it only costs a little bit of blood to pay the spirits of wind to work for you.

betterquesting.name: Tier 3 slates
betterquesting.desc: ...and even more blood.

betterquesting.name: Tier 2 slates
betterquesting.desc: You need MOOORE. Imbue some slates with even more blood.

betterquesting.name: Apprentice orb
betterquesting.desc: Your tier 2 orb.

betterquesting.name: Magican's orb
betterquesting.desc: Your tier 3 orb.

betterquesting.name: Elemental chalk
betterquesting.desc: Creation of better ritual stones.

betterquesting.name: Sacrificial runes
betterquesting.desc: Poking your finger might work for simple slates and runes, but getting enough blood for advanced stuff is tedious. With sacrificial runes you are able to increase the LP gain from mobs or yourself.

betterquesting.name: Tier 3 runes
betterquesting.desc: The first rune to increase your capacity, and a rune to speed up transfer from/to external tanks.

betterquesting.name: Basic rituals
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have access to elemental chalk, you can get yourself the basic ritual diviner. A convenient way to place simple but yet complex magical rituals.

betterquesting.name: Powerful armor
betterquesting.desc: A long way to go, and rather expensive, but a really powerful armor and well worth the effort.

betterquesting.name: Getting soul shards
betterquesting.desc: Enable your sword by Shift right-clicking and slay some enemies! Collect as many shards as possible. You will need a ton of them...

betterquesting.name: Bound armor
betterquesting.desc: Time to assemble your armor. You need to build the pattern with blocks as you would craft the armor in a crafting table. The soul forge must connect to the structure on at least 2 sides. Then, right click the forge block with an empty hand to craft the armor piece.

betterquesting.name: A bloodmage's sword
betterquesting.desc: Diamonds and emeralds are limited in their ability to store LP. With this sword, you are able to get the crystallized souls from your enemies. Time to go hunting.

betterquesting.name: Rituals
betterquesting.desc: Time for some rituals. The most basic one you'll probably get first is the ritual of binding.

betterquesting.name: Bound tools: Pickaxe
betterquesting.desc: Mining never was easier. Just right-click with this tool and all the stone is gone! Like all bound tools, this uses a massive amount of LP.

betterquesting.name: Bound tools: Shovel
betterquesting.desc: Ever wanted to clear out a large terrain with dirt, gravel and sand? Why not let demons do it? This shovel, imbued with the soul of a demon will unleash the power on your will. But be warned: The demon you're about to summon with this is thirsty, and it costs a lot of LP to make use of it, so make sure your LP pool is full!

betterquesting.name: Bound tools: Axe
betterquesting.desc: Upon right click while activated, this axe will clear out any wood within a large area. Be warned: This uses a huge amount of LP. You might suffer from sudden death...

betterquesting.name: A true blood-mage
betterquesting.desc: Bloodmagic is fine, so is Thaumcraft. Why not combine both worlds?

betterquesting.name: Complex spell system
betterquesting.desc: Unlike the simple spells with foci and paradigm, the complex spell system is incredible... complex. There are way too much combinations to cover them here, so it's advised to look for the knowledge in other places. However, with the items from this quest, you are able to craft a simple mining spell.

betterquesting.name: Steam > Tier 2
betterquesting.desc: Three steam backpacks give a better one = Tier 2.

betterquesting.name: Oak trees are not apple trees
betterquesting.desc: Oak trees which give apples?  Who the hell added this to minecraft? You find a way of combining an oak sapling and an apple to get an apple tree sapling. Try to plant one to get a permanent source of food.

betterquesting.name: Basic > Steam
betterquesting.desc: Three basic lootbags give a better one = Steam.

betterquesting.name: "Backed" potatoes
betterquesting.desc: Eating raw potatoes isn't that healthy, as you might have noticed. Some potatoes are green and poisonous already. After you get a furnace you can make delicious baked potatoes as another food alternative. Put a baked potato on a stick to make it even more delicious.

betterquesting.name: Tier 2 > Tier 3
betterquesting.desc: Three Tier 2 backpacks give a better one = Tier 3.

betterquesting.name: Soft mallet adventure
betterquesting.desc: You now have some melon slices or pumpkins but what can you do with them? Well just eat them or... use a mallet to get some seeds... OK, let's craft one. Perhaps you can use this mallet for some other things too.

betterquesting.name: Tier 3 > Tier 4
betterquesting.desc: Three Tier 3 backpacks give a better one = Tier 4

betterquesting.name: Shields UP
betterquesting.desc: With a sword in one hand, what can you do with the other? Right, you need a shield. Let's make one.

betterquesting.name: Tier 4 > Tier 5
betterquesting.desc: Three Tier 4 backpacks give a better one = Tier 5.

betterquesting.name: Shield ppdate
betterquesting.desc: Your wooden shield is very weak. So you look for a better one. Looks like you need some leather, so go and find some cows.

betterquesting.name: Tier 5 > Tier 6
betterquesting.desc: Three Tier 5 backpacks give a better one = Tier 6.

betterquesting.name: Your first long range weapon
betterquesting.desc: Since you can't make any vanilla bow before LV and Tinkers weapons are not in this Tier you find a way to make a spear out of sticks, leather and a string. Get one because some infernal monsters are easier to kill with a long range weapon.

betterquesting.name: Trigger LoC
betterquesting.desc: Triggered by having a "Lamp of Cinders" in your inventory.

betterquesting.name: Trigger S
betterquesting.desc: Triggered by making a singularity.

betterquesting.name: Trigger Sh
betterquesting.desc: Triggered by making a "Shard of Creation".

betterquesting.name: Trigger LSS
betterquesting.desc: Triggered by making a "Life Shard" and a "Soul Shard".

betterquesting.name: Trigger MC
betterquesting.desc: Triggered by finding a "Mysterious Crystal".

betterquesting.name: Trigger Life
betterquesting.desc: Triggers the Life Canister Quest after a Wither death.

betterquesting.name: Trigger P
betterquesting.desc: Triggers if you have been on Pluto.

betterquesting.name: Trigger Pr
betterquesting.desc: Triggered by the Primordial Pearl.

betterquesting.name: Trigger Fo
betterquesting.desc: Triggers if you craft the Primordial Focus.

betterquesting.name: Trigger V
betterquesting.desc: Triggers after you craft a Vortex.

betterquesting.name: Trigger TE
betterquesting.desc: Triggers if you arrived at The End.

betterquesting.name: Trigger Ca
betterquesting.desc: Triggers if you craft the Catalyst.

betterquesting.name: Runes tier 2
betterquesting.desc: Speed rune is the only tier 2 rune. The speed rune does what its name implies, provides an additive 20% increase to the processing speed of the blood altar.

betterquesting.name: The technician part 2
betterquesting.desc: I will ask the technician about this stuff, but I need to reach a good reputation first. He is a busy man, and I don't want to be denied.

betterquesting.name: Trigger Nt
betterquesting.desc: Triggers if you get Neutronium Ore.

betterquesting.name: Trigger BP
betterquesting.desc: Triggers if you find Black Plutonium.

betterquesting.name: Trigger VC
betterquesting.desc: Triggers if you have a Void Capsule.

betterquesting.name: Trigger Tt
betterquesting.desc: Triggers if you get Thaumite Nuggets.

betterquesting.name: Collecting some berries
betterquesting.desc: Are you now waiting for the carrots to grow? Go and find some berry bushes and berries. The berries are a good source of food and you can put these bushes around your house to make a wall. It should provide a good protection against all those monsters that want to come into your house and kill you.

betterquesting.name: Berry medley
betterquesting.desc: Hmmm... what can you do with all those berries? Just eating? You will see that they have a very low saturation Level. Let's plant the new berry bushes and mix the berries to make some better food.

betterquesting.name: Food variants
betterquesting.desc: Maybe you noticed already that eating the same food too often is very boring and not healthy any more. Some food like tea leaf can be taken to the furnace and processed further. So take a break and drink a cup of tea. Maybe munch some tasty raisins as they are very nice.

betterquesting.name: Your first tool
betterquesting.desc: When your tinkers tables are ready you can craft your first tool. If you did not find a village yet you can only craft flint tools. Let's start with a pickaxe, an axe and a shovel. At this point swords are unobtainable since they need metals like iron or bronze which you will get at a later stage. In the meantime use your gregtech swords. Your new tools are weak at first but the more you use them the better they will get. They will level up to level 99 if you play long enough. Tool parts can be replaced for a bit of level XP, however the tool must be fully repaired first.

betterquesting.name: Making a better sword
betterquesting.desc: Now it's time to make your first tinkers sword. First you have to make blade, hand guard and tool rod cast forms. Melt some bronze in the smeltery and cast your tool parts. Tadaa... there is your first tinkers sword.

betterquesting.name: Upgrade 2.0
betterquesting.desc:
Find iron, copper and tin ore. Very funny... How can you mine these with just a flint pickaxe? 
I have an idea; bring me all the stone you mined with your flint pickaxe and I will give you a better tool head in exchange.

betterquesting.name: Upgrade #4: Upgrade tier 5
betterquesting.desc: To process more advanced materials like HSS-E, HSS-S, naquadah or draconium you need more than 4500K. Time to upgrade your EBF to 5400k.

betterquesting.name: Upgrade #3: Upgrade tier 6
betterquesting.desc: To process more advanced materials like naquadah-alloy you need more than 5400K. Upgrade your EBF to 7200k to increase the heat.

betterquesting.name: Upgrade #6: Upgrade tier 7
betterquesting.desc: To process the most advanced materials like neutronium, fluxed-electrum or awakened draconium you need more than 7200K. Upgrade your EBF to 9001k. (OVER 9000!!!)

betterquesting.name: Flint and steel
betterquesting.desc: After you make steel you are able to craft flint and steel. I guess you want to travel to the Nether as soon as possible but be aware; the Nether is a very dangerous place.

betterquesting.name: THE NETHER
betterquesting.desc: Now more dangerous with extra hardcore infernal mobs. Have fun and take care.

betterquesting.name: Malachite
betterquesting.desc: Another copper source  is "malachite" which can be found between Y level 10 and 40. This vein contains more iron ore variants like "brown limonite", "yellow limonite" and "banded iron ore".

betterquesting.name: Creosote oil
betterquesting.desc:
I guess you already processed a bit of wood into charcoal and wonder what you can do with all this creosote oil?
Well you can burn it in the normal furnace to cook your food or you can make more torches with it. Later in the LV age you probably should run diesel generators with it.

betterquesting.name: Animal farms
betterquesting.desc: Trying to get some leather or wool? You probably need to spend a lot of time hunting animals and traveling around, or you coul simply make a farm to get a decent amount of leather, wool and meat.

betterquesting.name: Gardener
betterquesting.desc: If you are wondering: Why do I never get seeds when destroying grass? You are right. Try to work with your new mattock on the grass blocks that do not have water anywhere nearby to find some seeds.

betterquesting.name: Can you hear the carrots grow?
betterquesting.desc:
Tired of waiting since your carrots grow sooooo slow... ?
Well I got an idea, bone meal will help you grow food in seconds. Ok, chop down some trees and I will trade you some bone meal.

betterquesting.name: You need MOOOOOOORE wood
betterquesting.desc: It's time to feed your new coke oven with some wood to get more charcoal. You are looking for the most efficient way to plant trees. Try to find some spruce saplings and some jungle saplings. Both can be planted in a 2x2 grid to get bigger trees.

betterquesting.name: Tanned leather
betterquesting.desc: You have found a way to make leather more durable and more resistant by further processing it. Make some bound leather from four pieces of leather, some strings and a woven cotton. Now you only have to hang it on a drying rack and wait about 10 minutes to get some tanned leather.

betterquesting.name: Need more space?
betterquesting.desc: As you might know: tanned leather is more resistant and good enough for a backpack. Let's get a digger's backpack and a miner's backpack. Each pack holds different items. So use both for your first true back-packed mining experience.

betterquesting.name: You need them all!
betterquesting.desc: There are many more backpacks: Hunter, builder, forester...

betterquesting.name: Better lunch bag
betterquesting.desc: Your lunch bag is now so abused and rather old so it's time to get something better. Let's craft a lunch box which can hold way more food.

betterquesting.name: Horseback riding
betterquesting.desc: Are you ready for a small trip? With your new lunch box, saddle, lead and of course a horse we can start a small journey.

betterquesting.name: Sleeping outside
betterquesting.desc: Carrying the bed with you all the time the looks very funny. Why don't you craft a sleeping bag to stay outside without placing a bed and changing your spawn point. Be warned: If you play on a server then you'd better sleep below Y level 128, as nights are very cold in the mountains...

betterquesting.name: Sheep hairdresser
betterquesting.desc: Killing sheep to get the wool is so ineffective. Making some shears would make sense if you need more wool.

betterquesting.name: Wire Cutter v.0.2alpha
betterquesting.desc: Small gears require a wire cutter to be made, so let's craft one.

betterquesting.name: Redstone
betterquesting.desc: If you didnt't find any Redstone veins, it is quite important to look for one now. Try your luck at Y level 5-40.

betterquesting.name: Oh, shiny! (Not platinum!)
betterquesting.desc: To make your first macerator you need two diamonds, and to enter the Twilight Forest you need one. Finding a diamond vein would help you a lot. Go and look for one at Y level 5-20.

betterquesting.name: How to make rubber
betterquesting.desc: Making rubber is now more complicated, you need raw rubber and sulfur. Finding a sulfur vein in the Nether seems like a good idea, doesn't it? Found on Y level 5-20.

betterquesting.name: More charcoal
betterquesting.desc:
You have found an alternative way of making charcoal with a "charcoal pile igniter". 
Go and start getting massive amounts of charcoal.

betterquesting.name: XP usage?!
betterquesting.desc:
Exploring some dungeons or fighting mobs probably gave you a lot of XP. Better use it to get iron, copper, tin or other useful dusts before you die during the next fight.
Place your tank on the ground and a drain on top. Now you can fill it with XP.

betterquesting.name: Diesel, creosote: Watch them BURN!
betterquesting.desc: You have almost made it. One last crafting step is required in order to advance to tier 2. Keep going!

betterquesting.name: First things first
betterquesting.desc: As usual. In order to get started with bees, you need a few basic things. Most importantly... a scoop.

betterquesting.name: Go find some bees
betterquesting.desc: The next thing to do: Find a few bee hives around the world. There are 11 mundane bees that can be found, of which 8 are located in the Overworld. Any kind of bee will work for this quest.

betterquesting.name: A new home
betterquesting.desc: Now that you've destroyed the poor bees homes, you should build them a new one.

betterquesting.name: Analyze them all
betterquesting.desc: Every bee has multiple properties that define what the bee does, how it behaves in rain or at night, and a couple of other aspects. It is mandatory to keep track of those properties.

betterquesting.name: Scan or not to scan
betterquesting.desc: In order to get into bee breeding, you need a way to see all the traits, active and inactive. You only want to breed so called "pure" bees; For those, both "Active" and "Inactive" traits are identical.

betterquesting.name: Top-Tier analyser
betterquesting.desc: The best you can get, for all your scanning and analysing needs.

betterquesting.name: To play god
betterquesting.desc:
In order to continue with bees, to mutate and breed them as you like, you need mutagen. This greenish, smelly liquid needs to be refined from bacterial sludge, that seems to be available only on Mars. You will be able to continue, once you've arrived there.

In the meantime you can start working with the Genetics mod, since we all know Gendustry is too easy... Check out the recipes and you will understand why you should look into the Genetics mod.

betterquesting.name: Upgraded home
betterquesting.desc: The bee house can be used to stabilize mutations, for example if you have successfully bred two different bees, but the passive traits are different from the active ones. Still to actually breed those together, you need something different.

betterquesting.name: Mutatron
betterquesting.desc: Mutations can be boring, they can be annoying, and most times, they are frustrating. With this machine, you will get a 100% pure bred mutation. If the combination of princess and drone can result in multiple mutations, the outcome is random. But who cares?

betterquesting.name: Genetic sampler
betterquesting.desc: With this machine, you can extract a random trait from any bee, sapling, butterfly or flower. The bee/sapling/butterfly/flower will be destroyed in this process. Each process requires an empty gene sample and some labware.

betterquesting.name: Diamondware
betterquesting.desc: Also known as labware. Be prepared. In order to do serious bee-work, you need stacks of diamonds. I'm not joking, stacks!

betterquesting.name: Genetic imprinter
betterquesting.desc: With this powerful machine, you can inject gene samples, which allows you to alter any aspect of your bee/tree or butterfly. The gene sample (or pattern) will not be destroyed. The success rate is 100%, and one labware is consumed per injection.

betterquesting.name: Genetic transposer
betterquesting.desc: DNA samples of species and/or traits are pretty valuable. You always should keep at least one of each effect/trait/species you get your hand on in a chest somewhere safe. By using this machine, you are able to copy any DNA sample, for the cost of an empty serum vial and some labware.

betterquesting.name: Advanced mutatron
betterquesting.desc: A more advanced version of the mutatron. It uses more energy to mutate a drone with a princess, but the mutation is a 100% success, and you can select which mutation you want to have. This machine is a must-have for high-tier bees.

betterquesting.name: Blank gene sample
betterquesting.desc:
To get the various traits from a bee, you need a lot of power, labware and an empty gene sample. You don't need a lot of those, as you can just throw them in a furnace to remove remaining DNA of traits you don't need or want. 

In the meantime you can start working with the Genetics mod, since we all know Gendustry is too easy... Check out the recipes and you will understand why you should look into the Genetics mod.

betterquesting.name: Genetic template
betterquesting.desc: Templates are used to combine multiple gene samples into one large batch. It can be used to apply multiple traits at once, but you can also replicate a bee from liquid DNA and protein, if you manage to fill all 13 traits in one template. These templates can also be copied, just like the small samples.

betterquesting.name: A rather cruel disposal
betterquesting.desc: You probably will end up with a lot of excess drones while doing bees. (Or saplings if you do trees). Instead of throwing them away, you could also turn them into... Something useful.

betterquesting.name: Arnie's blender
betterquesting.desc: They say, breakfast is the most important meal of the day. This machine turns raw meat into liquid protein, which is used to create bees from scratch.

betterquesting.name: And there shall be light
betterquesting.desc: Out of princesses to inject traits to? Too lazy to find hives and get more bees? Not a problem. With this nifty little device, you can use a ton of power, liquid DNA and protein to create any bee you wish to have. The only drawback is: All bees will be ignoble, which means they will die after a random amount of cycles.

betterquesting.name: Only the Best: Temperature 3
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Only the Best: Humidity 3
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Only the Best: Fertility 4
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Highend species: Draconic
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Highend species: Doctoral
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Only the Best: Speed Fastest
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Highend species: Silicon
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Only the Best: Rain
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Only the Best: Day and Night
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: Only the Best: Cave
betterquesting.desc: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

betterquesting.name: You're gonna hate this #5
betterquesting.desc: The fifth item you'll need a lot of. For the microwave, the scanner, the precision laser engraver, etc.

betterquesting.name: You're gonna hate this #6
betterquesting.desc: The sixth item you'll need a lot of. For the scanner and the seismic prospector.

betterquesting.name: Scanning bees, crops and moooooore!
betterquesting.desc: Automate your bee or crop scanning. Later on, this machine gets very useful for scanning high tier machine parts for the assembly line research data or to fill data orbs with data for the UU matter production.

betterquesting.name: Diesel, oil or maybe creosote?
betterquesting.desc: You probably collected a ton of creosote and maybe even have built your first 'electric' blast furnace. creosote will be a good fuel for the moment. So try to build a few of the diesel generators and use them besides steam as a secondary power source.

betterquesting.name: Hydrogen, methane or some farts... (Natural gas)
betterquesting.desc: Some centrifugal processes leave gases behind like hydrogen or methane. Centrifuge some brown and yellow limonite to get hydrogen or dump your unused food in a centrifuge to get methane gas. Wood will even give 60 mb per log. Maybe it's time to build a forestry tree farm.

betterquesting.name: Pollution what....?
betterquesting.desc: If you are running your bricked blast furnace for a long time you will sometimes get headaches, nausea and other weird effects. Yes this is pollution... from making so much steel. If you can collect some rubber sheets, I will trade you a complete hazmat suit.

betterquesting.name: Redstone, early game processing
betterquesting.desc: Are you wondering how to process redstone without any macerator? Well you can mine it with a gregtech hammer and get the crushed ore. Then use with the hammer in the crafting table to get some impure redstone dust. After this, fill a cauldron with water and drop the dust in it. You will get pure redstone dust for your red alloy ingots.

betterquesting.name: Low tier wires
betterquesting.desc: Low tier wires like red alloy and tin can be made in a crafting table. Copper wire requires an alloy smelter. So let's make a mold for the rubber plates.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Witch)
betterquesting.desc: Witches are always infernal and very dangerous. Be careful since they throw potions at you.

betterquesting.name: Basic ore washer
betterquesting.desc: Macerating ores usually doubles the output. If you want MOOOOOOORE, craft an ore washer and wash out some rare materials.

betterquesting.name: Round and round and round...
betterquesting.desc: After purification of your ore dust, you can centrifuge it to get even more byproducts out of the dust.

betterquesting.name: A truly sharp saw blade
betterquesting.desc: Combining cobalt brass and diamond dust makes a really sharp saw blade for your cutting machine.

betterquesting.name: A new alloy
betterquesting.desc:
If you want to cut diamond blocks into plates, it's time to get a new alloy 'cobalt brass'.
First you need to make brass out of zinc (only found in small ores or as a centrifuge byproduct from tin or tetrahedrite) and copper. Mix it with aluminium and cobalt dust (can be centrifuged from various materials) to get the cobalt brass dust.

Now that you have come this far, we think that you are able to look up the ores that you need by yourself with the help of NEI and the ore mix spreadsheet.

betterquesting.name: Water and electricity, sounds fun and safe right?
betterquesting.desc: Using the power of water and electricity you can get even more out of your dusts.

betterquesting.name: C9H8O4...NaCl...H2O...
betterquesting.desc: Want to make some cetane-boosted diesel, plastic or some chemical dye? Then it's time to craft a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: Compact? Or is it?
betterquesting.desc:
It is a compressor but that doesn't mean it is compact... 

Hint:
It is highly recommended to get one of these electric compressors, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to compress something is a lot better when using EU.

betterquesting.name: Suction device... nice
betterquesting.desc:
I hope you are not thinking about what I am thinking you are thinking about... 

Hint:
It is highly recommended to get one of these, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to extracting something is a lot better when using EU.

betterquesting.name: Hello Baron, how is your black gold today?
betterquesting.desc:
During your travels you may have seen some of these huge oil wells. Now it's time to go make a pump and put this black gold into tanks. Oil can be burned in a diesel generator or be refined. 

Bring a diesel generator with you to power the pump. (Thanks to the advancement of technology the pumping machine can auto output on top.)

betterquesting.name: Your oil is too Crude? Refine it!
betterquesting.desc: Burning oil in the diesel generator is a very inefficient way of producing power. Every bucket/cell of oil only gives you 20,000 EU. Time to try and refine it...

betterquesting.name: Light Sulfuric Fuel
betterquesting.desc: The first step is to distill your oil into light sulfuric fuel, that has a burn value of 40,000 EU.

betterquesting.name: Light fuel
betterquesting.desc:
By adding hydrogen to sulfuric light fuel in a chemical reactor you can produce some light fuel with the very high burn value of 320,000 EU.

The remaining hydrogen sulfide cells can be used later to produce some sulfuric acid for your TNT/iTNT or acid batteries.

betterquesting.name: H like Hydrogen... rest of the alphabet is too complicated...
betterquesting.desc: Centrifuge some brown or yellow limonite dust to get some hydrogen, or use an Electrolyser with some water to produce it in a fluid form.

betterquesting.name: Heavy Sulfuric fuel
betterquesting.desc: The second step is to distill your oil into heavy sulfuric fuel, that has a burn value of 40,000 EU.

betterquesting.name: Heavy fuel
betterquesting.desc:
By adding hydrogen to sulfuric heavy fuel in a chemical reactor you can produce some heavy fuel with the burn value of 240,000 EU.

The remaining hydrogen sulfide cells can be used later to produce some sulfuric acid for your TNT/iTNT or acid batteries.

betterquesting.name: Diesel fuel
betterquesting.desc:
Mixing your light and heavy fuel together gives you some diesel.
It burns very well in the diesel generator with a burn value of 400,000 EU per cell.

betterquesting.name: Hey DJ, Mix it!
betterquesting.desc: The mixer is a very useful device. You can mix all kind of fluid and items. (Useful to prevent dust from falling to the ground when crafting.)

betterquesting.name: N like nitrogen... Hide, alphabet strikes again!
betterquesting.desc: You can get some nitrogen by centrifuging... air. This process takes a long time, especially at the LV tier.

betterquesting.name: Glyceryl trini...... what?
betterquesting.desc:
Kids, today we will make some glyceryl trinitrate with some glycerol.
    - Chemistry 101

betterquesting.name: NITRO! (Cetane-boosted diesel)
betterquesting.desc: 720,000 EU per cell. Yes, yes, this is very good! Make some cetane-boosted diesel fuel and power yourDiesel Engine with it.

betterquesting.name: Where can I put all the items in?
betterquesting.desc: After you make your first steel you're able to craft the small backpack. In this bag you can put a lot of the stuff you want to carry around. With 36 slots it's a bit bigger than a small chest.

betterquesting.name: Low pressure boiler tank
betterquesting.desc: The low pressure boiler tank is the easiest way to store steam. The firebox needs this tank on top to produce steam. The bigger the boiler the slower it heats up, but it will produce more steam when heated up.

betterquesting.name: Railcraft steam power
betterquesting.desc:
As an alternative way to steam you can use the railcraft boilers. They require at least one firebox.
More than one size is possible: (1x1 mentioned above) 2x2 and 3x3. Each boiler needs 1, 2 or 3 layers of tanks on top, depending on the size.

betterquesting.name: Liquid fuelled firebox
betterquesting.desc:
Cresosote oil into steam! After you make your first steel you are able to craft a liquid fueled firebox.
Diesel, ethanol, creosote and biofuel all work well here.

betterquesting.name: High pressure boiler tank
betterquesting.desc: After you make steel you are able to craft a high pressure boiler tank. The upgraded version increases the temperature and produces more steam than the low pressure version.

betterquesting.name: Bookshelves...? Ah forestry... Multiblock farms!
betterquesting.desc: The bookshelf can only be made with wood planks, which are made in a compressor. Perhaps someone thinks this is a bit crazy...

betterquesting.name: Forestry Basic > Advanced
betterquesting.desc: Three basic foresters lootbags give a better one = Advanced Foresters Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Forestry Advanced > Expert
betterquesting.desc: Three advanced foresters lootbags give a better one = Expert Foresters Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Space Invaders Moon > Space Invaders Mars
betterquesting.desc: Three space invaders Moon lootbags give a better one = Space Invaders Mars Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Space Invaders Mars > Space Invaders Asteroids
betterquesting.desc: Three space invaders Mars lootbags give a better one = Space Invaders Asteroids Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Novice > Adept
betterquesting.desc: Three novice lootbags give a better one = Adept Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Adept > Master
betterquesting.desc: Three adept lootbags give a better one = Master Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Master > Grandmaster
betterquesting.desc: Three master lootbags give a better one = Grandmaster Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Grandmaster > Grandmaster Unique
betterquesting.desc: Sixteen grandmaster lootbags give a better one = Grandmaster Unique Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: BM Novice > BM Adept
betterquesting.desc: Three BM novice lootbags give a better one = BM Adept Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: BM Adept > BM Master
betterquesting.desc: Three BM adept lootbags give a better one = BM Master Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Bee Basic > Advanced
betterquesting.desc: Three basic bee lootbags give a better one = Advanced Bee Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Bee Advanced > Expert
betterquesting.desc: Three advanced bee lootbags give a better one = Expert Bee Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Working table 2.0
betterquesting.desc:
A manual crafting table which remembers the last nine used recipes. Left click one of the recipes shown in the right-hand side to automatically fill in the crafting grid. Right-click to lock a memorized recipe and prevent a newer recipe from bumping it off.

Resources need to go into the internal inventory. The crafting matrix is only a visual representation.

The Forestry worktable is super-useful, and can reduce the tedium of many common jobs because you can click-drag across a row of items, and it will use tools in its own inventory to continue crafting. Specifically:
Making torches with creosote - just drag-click all your buckets into the worktable
Making fresh water for Pam's - Same as above
Making fresh milk for Pam's - Same as above
Making clay bricks - a wooden form is automatically reused
Making concrete - not tested, but would probably make this easier too.

betterquesting.name: Forestry core block
betterquesting.desc: This sturdy casing is the basis for almost all machines in Forestry, essentially being the forestry equivalent of a machine casing.

betterquesting.name: The carpenter
betterquesting.desc:
The Carpenter is similar to an automatic crafting table. It has an item input slot and a storage slot for the recipes. Some recipes need an additional fluid like water, creosote, honey or molten redstone. With the carpenter you can make farmblocks, woven backpacks, bee and tree analysers and many more.

The carpenter needs power to work. You can use a GT cable or a battery box to connect to the machine or make some forestry, railcraft or buildcraft RF engines.

betterquesting.name: Molten redstone?
betterquesting.desc:
You heard that the carpenter needs some molten redstone for a few recipes. 
Converting redstone dust into a fluid requires a fluid extractor. Let's build one.

betterquesting.name: Thermionic fabricator
betterquesting.desc: The thermionic fabricator is used to craft electron tubes and stained glass. It requires redstone flux (RF) energy to run. It is your first machine which is made in the carpenter. Once warmed up, it needs to maintain a certain heat level to operate. The amount of power supplied will determine how much heat will be generated. If you do not supply enough power to maintain the current temperature it will slowly drop.

betterquesting.name: Tubes
betterquesting.desc:
Before you can craft your first farm block you need apatite tubes. Make some apatite long rods first (Using a lathe or extruder). You need golden bolts and a red alloy plate.
Put some glass or sand into your thermionic fabricator and make your first tubes.

betterquesting.name: Your first multiblock farm
betterquesting.desc: The smallest farm you can build requires 36 farm blocks. For water input you need a valve, items go through the hatches and to supply the farm with energy you need a gearbox. With the farm control block you can control which fields of your farm work by applying a redstone signal. Remember to put creosote in the carpenter when crafting the different farm blocks.

betterquesting.name: Farm logic
betterquesting.desc: This chip is optional and more advanced. The farms are working without them too. But if you want to configure your farm you will need one of them.

betterquesting.name: Change your farm circuit configuration
betterquesting.desc:
The (forestry) soldering iron is a tool used for attaching electron tubes to circuit boards in order to manipulate how an electrical engine works or to program multiblock farms. As well as upgrading the squeezer or centrifuge.
Once electron tubes have been attached to a circuit board they cannot be removed, only replaced. The circuit board is automatically crafted as soon as the basic recipe requirements are met, so it's best practice to first place your electron tubes and then add the circuit board.

The soldering iron can also be used to remove the circuit board from electrical engines, multiblock farms, squeezers and centrifuges by opening the machine's GUI and left clicking with the soldering iron on the circuit board slot.

betterquesting.name: Heating coils
betterquesting.desc: Your thermionic fabricator needs heating coils to function. So combine some magnetized (requires polarizer) steel rods with some copper wire and make some.

betterquesting.name: Welcome to forestry
betterquesting.desc: Want to make some automated farms or work with bee and tree breeding? Then this is the right chapter for you.

betterquesting.name: Magnetize your rods
betterquesting.desc: Magnetic steel rods need a polariser to craft. Make a few for your coils.

betterquesting.name: Finding Apatite
betterquesting.desc: It's now time to search for some ores. Apatite is the most basic material in Forestry. You can make fertilizer, farm blocks and many other things. The vein is found between Y level 40-60.

betterquesting.name: Multiblock farm: Hatch
betterquesting.desc:
Farm hatch (Pipe connectivity)

You can supply and extract items from the farm by using farm hatches that are connected to pipe systems. 

Supplying items
The farm hatch is clever enough to know which item goes where. If an item isn't appropriate for the farm's configuration, the hatch will simply reject it.

Extracting items
Any item that is harvested by the Multifarm is automatically ejected by the farm hatches into inventories or pipes. Pipes can be used to extract from other sides.

betterquesting.name: Multiblock farm: Valve
betterquesting.desc:
Farm valve (Hydration)

Some farms require water for hydration purposes. Although you can do it manually by supplying it through liquid containers (such as cans), you can also automate the process by using farm valves.

By connecting fluid pipes into the farm valve and supplying water, you can automatically fill the farm's water tank.

betterquesting.name: Multiblock farm: Control block
betterquesting.desc:
Farm control

You can control which fields of your farm work by applying a redstone signal to the control block. You can either shut down the whole farm by applying a redstone signal from top or below or you can disable a specific side by applying a redstone signal on the matching side of the control block.

betterquesting.name: Multiblock farm: Gearbox
betterquesting.desc:
Farm gearbox (Power)
To power your farm and have it automatically harvest crops, you will need at least one farm gearbox.

Farm operations can be hastened with additional gearboxes.

Each farm gearbox requires power. You can use either RF or EU.

betterquesting.name: Farm logic enhanced
betterquesting.desc: This chip is optional and more advanced than the basic one. The farms can work without them too. If you want to configure your farm you will need one of them.

betterquesting.name: Farm logic refined
betterquesting.desc: This chip is optional and more advanced than the enhanced one. The farms are working without them too. If you want to configure your farm even more you will need one of them.

betterquesting.name: Farm logic intricate
betterquesting.desc: This chip is optional and more advanced than the refined one. The farms are working without them too. If you want to configure your farm even more you will need one of them.

betterquesting.name: Upgrade of the upgrade of the...
betterquesting.desc: It's upgrade time. Unlock redstone and obsidian level for your different tools.

betterquesting.name: Tetrahedrite, stibnite and copper
betterquesting.desc:
Maybe you are wondering why you need tetrahedrite or stibnite. Well, antimony can be centrifuged out of it which is very useful for batteries in the LV Age.
The veins can be found between Y level 80-120.

betterquesting.name: Antimony
betterquesting.desc: The most efficient way to get antimony for batteries is to centrifuge stibnite dust, the second most efficient way is to use tetrahedrite dust.

betterquesting.name: Thermal centrifuge
betterquesting.desc: A optional machine to get different byproducts out of your crushed and purified ore dust. This machine becomes very useful when you have reactors and want to recycle your depleted fuel rods.

betterquesting.name: Hunger, no more
betterquesting.desc: The hunger is constantly following you, consuming you, never letting you rest. The world around you is full of nourishing fruits, vegetables and crafted meals. Use them to curb your insatiable hunger.

betterquesting.name: Building made easy
betterquesting.desc: Placing blocks by hand can be tedious. Wouldn't it be nice to be able to place blocks like "Another 9 here"? Well, good news. Get yourself some of the various building blocks, and I shall reward you with something nice.

betterquesting.name: Spatial distortions
betterquesting.desc: You detected a weird disturbance in the air around an enderman, I suggest you try to steal some of their pearls and research them.

betterquesting.name: Dimensional chest
betterquesting.desc: You've heard rumors, that the endermen had build laboratories in the End. To invent new machines and weapons in order to attack the Overworld. One of their inventions is a chest, which is somehow linked to all instances of itself. Go and try to find one of those.

betterquesting.name: RF Batteries
betterquesting.desc: Basic Capacitors are RF batteries which can store the RF power you generate. You can put many blocks together to enlarge your total battery capacity.

betterquesting.name: Slay the Eyes!
betterquesting.desc: Find and kill Ender-Eyes, guarding the Defence Towers

betterquesting.name: Ender Guardians
betterquesting.desc: Well if you decided to grind then do it... Kill some of the guardians.

betterquesting.name: Slay the Dragon. (Again)
betterquesting.desc: If you're bored, you can resurrect the dragon. Or, you could find a chaos dragon, if you dare. Anyway, kill one of those, and you'll be well rewarded.

betterquesting.name: A lead about lead that leads to lead dust
betterquesting.desc: The next step of making batteries is to collect some lead. Lead and galena veins can be found in the Twilight Forest at y levels 5 - 45.

betterquesting.name: Battery alloy
betterquesting.desc:
Mixing antimony and lead in the alloy smelter will give you some battery alloy.
Combine it with some tin cable and voila there is your small battery hull.

betterquesting.name: Lead, galena and silver
betterquesting.desc: You can't find lead, galena or silver in the Overworld or the Nether. So it's time to explore the mysterious Twilight Forest a bit and find this vein at Y level 5 - 40.

betterquesting.name: Single use battery: Mercury
betterquesting.desc:
Mercury and acid batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.

They can be placed in the battery slot of any standard LV gregtech machine, in that case they will be depleted before the machine's internal EU storage. They can also be used in LV battery buffers.

betterquesting.name: Single use battery: Acid
betterquesting.desc:
Mercury and acid Batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.

They can be placed in the battery slot in any standard LV gregtech machine, in that case they will be depleted before the machine's internal EU storage. They can also be used in LV battery buffers.

betterquesting.name: Reusable battery: Sodium
betterquesting.desc: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

betterquesting.name: Reusable battery: Cadmium
betterquesting.desc: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

betterquesting.name: Reusable battery: Lithium
betterquesting.desc: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

betterquesting.name: Mercury
betterquesting.desc: Mercury can be centrifuged out of redstone. If you find some cinnabar ore in the redstone vein you can use that too.

betterquesting.name: Fluid canner
betterquesting.desc:
The fluid canner is a fundamental machine, since it is necessary to move fluids around, as well as for filling tin cells, glass bottles, buckets, and even batteries.

Another interesting thing about the fluid canner is that it can be transformed into a raintank, by attaching a drain cover on its top (Any machine with tank actually can be...).

betterquesting.name: Sulfuric acid
betterquesting.desc: Combining hydrogen sulfide and water in the chemical reactor will give you sulfuric acid for your single use acid batteries. If you have made some light or heavy fuel already maybe you have some spare hydrogen sulfide. If not, you can always make sulfuric acid with some sulfur and water in the chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: Battery buffer
betterquesting.desc: Batteries can be placed directly in machines. To recharge a battery you need a battery buffer. They come in different sizes: 1, 4, 9 and 16 slots.

betterquesting.name: IC2 Battery
betterquesting.desc: Some recipes require IC2 batteries. Fill your small battery hull with some molten redstone and you will get your RE-Battery.

betterquesting.name: How to get sodium
betterquesting.desc: A second source for sodium is glauconite ore or glauconite sand. This type of ore vein can be found at Y level 20-50.

betterquesting.name: How to get sodium/lithium
betterquesting.desc:
Salt ore mixes can be found in the Overworld between Y level 50-70. Salt isn't only used to get sodium, it's an important ingredient in many pam's harvestcraft food recipes.

Hint: Lepidolite and spodumene are good sources of lithium for your batteries.

betterquesting.name: A big meteorite
betterquesting.desc:
The best way to get rare earth is to find an applied energistics 2 meteorite and grind the blocks into dust. Maybe you completed the quest in the steam age and stored your crushed skystone somewhere? That dust can now be centrifuged into various byproducts like cadmium, neodymium, caesium, lanthanum, and yttrium.

Hint: Redstone has rare earth as byproduct. Chalcopyrite (at HV level) and sphalherite (at LV level) have cadmium as byproduct.

betterquesting.name: Basic canner
betterquesting.desc: The canning machine is mainly used to fill tin cans with any kind of food, but it is useful for filling and emptying tin cells with other solid items than food, usually in the form of dust. It can also fill batteries with redstone, cadmium, lithium or sodium.

betterquesting.name: Packing your tanks chests and barrels
betterquesting.desc:
Packing your chests and barrels without spilling all the things (buildcraft(tm))? 
No problem! Make a dolly and you can carry your full chests, barrels or storage drawers anywhere you want. But be warned, you will get a slowness debuff so hopefully you don't have to travel very far. Not portable buildcraft and iron tanks can moved so too without loosing fluids.

betterquesting.name: Portable mob spawners..? Cool!
betterquesting.desc: Do you want to move the spawners around and build some cool mob farms? That will be no problem if you get the diamond dolly.

betterquesting.name: Grain bait
betterquesting.desc: Crafting some nice grain bait for your animal trap.

betterquesting.name: Fruit bait
betterquesting.desc: Crafting some tasty fruit bait for your animal trap.

betterquesting.name: Veggie bait
betterquesting.desc: Crafting some veggie bait for your animal trap.

betterquesting.name: Fish bait
betterquesting.desc: Crafting some fish bait for your fish trap.

betterquesting.name: Animal trapping
betterquesting.desc: Tired of hunting for cows, zombies or sheep? You can build a trap and hope some animal or monster drops will be caught by the netting inside.

betterquesting.name: A fisherman's friend
betterquesting.desc: Have you ever tried to catch a fish with your bare hands? It's time to craft a fishing rod and get some fish the easy way. Cast your fishing rod in some water and wait until the bobber dips below the surface. Then reel back in your line and hopefully you caught yourself something nice.

betterquesting.name: Fish trapping
betterquesting.desc: Fishing can be very boring. Why not to automate it with a fish trap?

betterquesting.name: Wheat time
betterquesting.desc: It's time to plant some wheat to make some bread or to prepare grain bait for your animal traps.

betterquesting.name: Floury flurry
betterquesting.desc:
The first step in making bread is to macerate your wheat into flour with a mortar or a macerator.

Flour can be used in many food recipes for different pam's harvestcraft foods.

betterquesting.name: First handmade bread
betterquesting.desc:
Baking your dough in a Furnace makes some tasty bread.
Your first bread!

betterquesting.name: Do'h!
betterquesting.desc:
Water and flour makes a dough or two...
Dough can be used in many different food recipes from pam's harvestcraft.

betterquesting.name: Tasty toast
betterquesting.desc: Smelt your bread again and you get some toast!? Give's you more nutrition points, and unlocks more culinary potential!

betterquesting.name: Sulfuric naphtha
betterquesting.desc: Another distillate you can make out of oil is sulfuric naphtha with a burn value of 40,000 EU per cell in the gas turbine.

betterquesting.name: LPG
betterquesting.desc: Centrifuging some Butane or Propane gives you LPG with a burn value of 320,000 EU, the same as naphtha. Also it is a way to get methane and eventually epichlorohydrin.

betterquesting.name: Naphtha
betterquesting.desc:
You can process sulfuric naphtha to fluid naphtha which has a burn value of 320,000 EU in the gas turbine.
Naphtha is also a base product for polyethylene and polycaprolactam.

betterquesting.name: Sulfuric gas
betterquesting.desc: Another distillate for your gas turbine you can make out of oil is sulfuric gas with a burn value of 25,000 EU per cell.

betterquesting.name: Refinery gas
betterquesting.desc: Refine your gas in a chemical reactor with hydrogen gas to give it a better burn value of 160,000 EU, and maybe use it to make methane gas.

betterquesting.name: Methane
betterquesting.desc: Distilling some "refinery gases" gives you some methane gas. There are many more ways to get methane.

betterquesting.name: Glider wings
betterquesting.desc: If for some reason you want to be able to jump down a cliff without getting the message "Player X fell from a high place". A great idea would be to find a way to soften your landing first. The hang glider should do that just fine.

betterquesting.name: Electrotine battery
betterquesting.desc:
The electrotine battery is exclusively used in project red machines and the jetpack.
Electrotine is a mixture of redstone and electrum dust.

betterquesting.name: Electrotine jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
Your glider gets you to the ground safely but it does not have any method to get up. After you researched electrotine you discovered that it is powerful enough for your first jetpack.
A diamond chestplate surrounded with 4 electrotine batteries is powerful enough to bring you up in the air.

It does not have a hover mode so you better take your glider with you. 

Hint: This jetpack can't fly higher than Y level 128.

betterquesting.name: Refill your jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
GREAT.... you now have an empty jetpack.
You need 25 electrotine dust to completely fill it.
Let's craft an electrotine generator and a charging bench to use the power of electrotine. 
You will very quickly discover that, while it is fast and cheap, it's empty in the blink of an eye. Despite this, it is useful in combination with the hang glider to get into the air and to get away from hairy situations.

betterquesting.name: Coal steam jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
Your coal jetpack needs coal and water to produce steam. After a short warm-up period you can go and take it for a ride. Keep in mind you will need your glider to make a soft landing.

Put your jetpack on your back and hit Shift and the adventure backpacks action-key to start it.

Max flying height for these jetpacks is the Y level of 185.

Vertical velocity decreases linearly with height after overcoming optimal height - 135 for jetpack and 100 for copter.

betterquesting.name: Copter jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
The copter jetpack is the first jetpack with a hover mode. It is using all kind of different fuel types in buckets. 
Buckets of creosote, lava, oil and fuel will work.
Equip your jetpack and hit Shift and the adventure backpacks action-key. You can also switch between hover and normal mode.

Max flying height is limited to Y level 200. 

Vertical velocity decreases linearly with height after overcoming optimal height - 135 for jetpack and 100 for copter.

betterquesting.name: Electric jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
Your first electrical jetpack. You need to hit the IC2 mode-switch key to toggle between normal mode and hover mode.

The only limitation is that you can't fly higher than Y level 185.

betterquesting.name: Fueled jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
This jetpack uses IC2 biogas and can fly up to Y level 245.
You can switch between hover and normal mode using the IC2 mode-switch key.

Your jetpack can be (re-)fueled in the IC2 fluid canner with 30 buckets/cells worth of biogas.

betterquesting.name: Advanced electric jetpack
betterquesting.desc:
The advanced electric jetpack is an upgraded version of the electric jetpack.
While worn in the chest armor slot and charged with EU, it allows the player to fly. It provides no armor protection, but will charge tools being used in the same manner as the advanced lappack from its 3.000.000 EU internal storage.

The advanced electric jetpack is limited to a maximum flying height of Y level 256.

betterquesting.name: Advanced nano chestplate
betterquesting.desc: Combining the advanced electric jetpack and nanosuit yields you the advanced nano chestplate. Now you have the protection of the chestplate combined with the freedom of movement of the jetpack.

betterquesting.name: Gravi suit
betterquesting.desc: The gravi chestplate is the ultimate quantum armor combined with a high powered jetpack. It also has hidden features that you need to discover while wearing the whole quantum armor.

betterquesting.name: Iron shields
betterquesting.desc: You have been using your hide shield long enough. After you make your first tools, grab a bit of iron ore and make a nice iron shield.

betterquesting.name: Stone spear
betterquesting.desc:
Upgrade your wooden spear with a stone arrowhead and iron screws to a stone spear.
This spear has better durability than the wooden one.

betterquesting.name: Iron spear
betterquesting.desc:
Upgrade your wooden spear with an iron arrowhead and two steel screws to an iron spear. 
The iron spear has better durability than the stone variant.

betterquesting.name: Diamond spear
betterquesting.desc:
At MV Tier you can upgrade your iron spear to a diamond one. Get a diamond arrowhead, two stainless steel screws and a wooden spear.
This spear has superior durability.

betterquesting.name: Diamond shield
betterquesting.desc: Your iron shield got very old. With a shield made from diamond plates you can maintain block for up to 5 seconds.

betterquesting.name: Bow, arrows and quiver
betterquesting.desc:
Wow, your first handmade *ehm* machine made bow. You find out that you can put the bow in the mine and blade battlegears slots. Now it's time to make a quiver and maybe some arrows. You can put up to 4 stacks of arrows in your quiver.

Let's go hunt a bit.

betterquesting.name: Basic arc furnace
betterquesting.desc: The arc furnace is an alternative to smelting stuff back into components and making wrought iron. The recipes use oxygen and 3 amperes of power.

betterquesting.name: Faster steel production
betterquesting.desc: A faster alternative to steel production is to use the arc furnace and smelt the iron ingots into wrought iron ingots. Then macerate them to dust and smelt them very fast in the EBF to steel. (Some might even dare arc furnacing the dust itself...)

betterquesting.name: LV battery buffer 4 slots
betterquesting.desc:
Upgrade your battery buffer to hold 4 batteries which allows max 4 ampere output.
Useful for your EBF and the arc furnace.

betterquesting.name: Kitchenware
betterquesting.desc:
To cook some healthy food you need a few tools crafted first.
Saucepan, 
pot, 
rolling pin, 
mortar, 
mixing bowl, 
soft mallet, 
skillet, 
knife...

betterquesting.name: Row, row, row your boat
betterquesting.desc:
You live close to the water and don't have a boat?
