You need wooden planks, slabs and a knife to craft one. (This is also quest id 666, be careful, something is going on.)

betterquesting.name: Trainspotting
betterquesting.desc:
The wooden tracks can be made without any machine. Functionally equivalent to normal rails, but with a lower maximum speed (for safety reasons).

Hint: You can use your wooden rails for Steve's carts farms.

betterquesting.name: Rubber boat
betterquesting.desc: The rubber dinghy requires only a few rubber plates. Like the vanilla wooden boat, it will break and dismantle whenever it hits a surface, however instead of returning sticks and planks, it will return a damaged rubber dinghy, which can be re-crafted with two pieces of rubber back into a useable rubber dinghy!

betterquesting.name: Inflatable boot
betterquesting.desc: I meant to say boat... The inflatable boat is the first boat that doesn't break on impact with a solid block.

betterquesting.name: Carbon fiber boat
betterquesting.desc:
Unlike all other boats, this amazing carbon fiber canoe is COMPLETELY INDESTRUCTIBLE!* This means that you can smash it into as many beaches, lily pads and alligators as you like, the carbon fiber canoe won't take a scratch!

Warning: We are not held responsible for any damage caused by riding the carbon fiber canoe into a lava lake or the Void.

*Therefore, warranty is NOT included.

betterquesting.name: Electric boat
betterquesting.desc: The alectric boat works mostly like a vanilla boat, chugging through the water at a decent pace. It will hopefully drop itself once you crash, which is slightly nicer than the usual sticks. That's all well and good, but what if we utilize the electric engine? Wearing an energy storage device in your chestplate slot, like a batpack or energypack, will cause the boat to drain energy from it and propel you forward at supersonic speed! Doing this will consume about 100 EU per block traveled, so even a decent batpack won't last long!

betterquesting.name: Boat shape?
betterquesting.desc: Really? Yes for the more advanced boats you need a new shape form.

betterquesting.name: LV extruder
betterquesting.desc: The extruder is not very useful in the LV age. But it will extrude your next tier of boat.

betterquesting.name: Wooden rail variants
betterquesting.desc: The wooden junction, wye and switch tracks need an assembling machine to craft. They allow you to join and switch to tracks going to different locations.

betterquesting.name: Switch lever
betterquesting.desc:
The switch lever is the manual version of the switch motor, requiring a player to operate it instead of a redstone signal. 
It is used in various signaling systems, mainly to change the way switch tracks and wye tracks work.

betterquesting.name: Crowbar
betterquesting.desc:
The crowbar comes in a Railcraft and a gregtech variant. It is used to manipulate machines from railcraft, remove plates and any other covers (pumps, conveyor belts, etc.) from gregtech pipes and machines as well as breaking certain objects faster, such as tracks. This tool is also used to access certain inventories from Railcraft.

The crowbar can be used as a weapon, though it costs twice as much durability on attack (just like any other non weapon tool...).

betterquesting.name: Minecart
betterquesting.desc:
After you craft your first cart the journey can begin...
Well, not really. You will need some kind of tracks first.

betterquesting.name: Fast Food > Slow Food
betterquesting.desc: Three fast food lootbags give a better one = Slow Food Lootbag. (Since when is slow food better?)

betterquesting.name: Slow Food > Haute Cuisine
betterquesting.desc: Three slow food lootbags give a better one = Haute Cuisine Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Haute Cuisine > Dessert
betterquesting.desc: Six haute cuisine lootbags give a better one = Dessert Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Transportation Class 3 > Transportation Class 2
betterquesting.desc: Three transportation class 3 lootbags give a better one = Transportation Class 2 Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Transportation Class 2 > Transportation Class 1
betterquesting.desc: Three transportation class 2 Lootbags give a better one = Transportation Class 1 Lootbag.

betterquesting.name: Wet dirt armor?
betterquesting.desc: If you don't have any armor, "mud armor" is better than nothing. Mud can be found in some wet biomes.

betterquesting.name: Wooden armor
betterquesting.desc: If you can't find mud you can make very poor armor out of wood. Cutting down a few trees to make a set should do. You will need a soft mallet too, so save a few logs for that.

betterquesting.name: Armor 2.0
betterquesting.desc: Iron armor is much better than the leather armor. Especially when you have to go outside during the night.

betterquesting.name: Leather armor
betterquesting.desc:
Killing some cows will give you enough leather to craft a complete set of leather armor. 

Hint: You are able to dye this armor.

betterquesting.name: Bronze armor
betterquesting.desc: Bronze armor has the same abilities as iron armor. Same durability, same protection and same enchantment capability.

betterquesting.name: "Nice to have" armor
betterquesting.desc: The gold armor is a "nice to have" armor. The durability is very low but you look expensive when you wear it.

betterquesting.name: "Oh shiny" armor
betterquesting.desc: Diamond armor is the best armor in Vanilla Minecraft, but over here there are much better armors available.

betterquesting.name: Fancy armor
betterquesting.desc: Not really better but fancy. The chain mail armor is made out of steel rings.

betterquesting.name: Armor 2.5
betterquesting.desc: The steel armor has much more durability than the iron/bronze or chainmail armor.

betterquesting.name: Composite vest
betterquesting.desc: Combining the strength of advanced alloy plates with the steel chestplate makes your vest very hard. Now you have double the durability and increased armor points by 1,5.

betterquesting.name: Fallen from the sky
betterquesting.desc:
There are big meteors everywhere and you are wondering why you need to mine them now?
Skystone is a good source of rare earth metals in the LV age. 
Inside the meteor you can find a skystone chest containing some processor press plates. Save them for later, as they are really important.

betterquesting.name: One Anvil... Better make that two!
betterquesting.desc:
With your brand-new Compressor you are able to make some metal blocks for your new anvil. Better craft two anvils, one will be required for the forge hammer.

With the anvil you can repair, rename and enchant armor and tools.

betterquesting.name: Automation tier 1
betterquesting.desc:
Do you want to automate your smeltery because you are planning to make stacks of glass blocks? 
No problem, craft a large bronze pipe and place it under the faucet. Now the molten fluid will flow inside the pipe. Under the pipe you have to place the casting basins or tables.
A hopper and a chest underneath would be good to auto-output products.

betterquesting.name: Automation tier 2
betterquesting.desc: You want a better automation than using pipes? Sure, craft a comparator and link it with redstone dust placed on the ground. The redstone needs to be adjecent to the faucet to activate the crafting process.

betterquesting.name: 2x steel
betterquesting.desc: Steel production is so slow. If you got enough bricks and clay, build a second BBF. Build it attached to the first one, so they can share a wall an you will save some bricks, clay and concrete.

betterquesting.name: 4x steel
betterquesting.desc: Not even two BBFs are fast enough...

betterquesting.name: Why one coke oven when you can have ten
betterquesting.desc: Your bricked blast furnace uses coal like hell and your steam boiler too? Well it's time to make more coke ovens and automate them a bit. Wooden fluid pipes and tin item pipes will help you reach your goal.

betterquesting.name: How dark can you go?
betterquesting.desc: Seriously, how dark can one be? You are sure the face in that crystal was nothing but imagination...

betterquesting.name: Ascended
betterquesting.desc: You feel empowered, light, almost like a ghost.

betterquesting.name: Tier 5 slates
betterquesting.desc: 1023 Buckets of blood in one slate! How much more I can store, oh I wish I would know. Then I add one and check if it works. 1024 buckets of blood in one slate! ... ...

betterquesting.name: Powerful shards
betterquesting.desc: The demons summoned are rather strong, but their souls contain immense power!

betterquesting.name: Tier 4 slates
betterquesting.desc: Tier 4 slates: Getting close.

betterquesting.name: Accelerated plant growth
betterquesting.desc: Plants grow very slowly, you might've discovered that by now. So why you don't counter that? A watering can will come in handy very soon.

betterquesting.name: Ethereal chalk
betterquesting.desc: Top tier chalk, for fancy wall paintings?

betterquesting.name: Archmage orb. Let them come!
betterquesting.desc: Your tier 5 orb.

betterquesting.name: Master orb: Getting close
betterquesting.desc: Your tier 4 orb.

betterquesting.name: Elemental chalk II
betterquesting.desc: Enhanced elemental chalk, to write "darker" runes than you're used to...

betterquesting.name: Tier 4 runes
betterquesting.desc: You will want both runes. Rune of superior capacity to increase the storage of your blood altar, and rune of the orb. Later it is required if you want to advance to higher levels.

betterquesting.name: Tier 5 runes
betterquesting.desc: The final frontier: There are not many runes available. The acceleration rune allows you to speed up the interaction with external tanks.

betterquesting.name: Advanced rituals
betterquesting.desc: More powerful rituals require dusk runes. With your new dusk chalk, you can enhance your ritual diviner to place those. Allowing you to perform a lot more rituals.

betterquesting.name: Highend rituals
betterquesting.desc: The last rune so far, used for the most powerful rituals.

betterquesting.name: Convocation of the damned
betterquesting.desc: Time to open a portal to the demons we're using all the time. What could possibly go wrong? (It is recommended to do this ritual on a planet, as the demon city will spread quite a bit...)

betterquesting.name: Imbued spell upgrades
betterquesting.desc: With these new shards you are able to craft the most powerful spell components. Maybe it's time to upgrade your mining spell?

betterquesting.name: Find some Quartz
betterquesting.desc: The Nether is full of different kinds of quartz. Go and find a quartzite and certus quartz vein. It is located between Y level 40-80.

betterquesting.name: Good Circuits.
betterquesting.desc: Good circuits are an improvement on basic circuits. They are a component of all MV gregtech machines. Be sure you build the electric blast furnace first, so you can process some aluminium dust into ingots.

betterquesting.name: Crop Breeding
betterquesting.desc:
If you ever wanted to know how crop breeding works you are in the right place. Get some crops (the sticks) and some seeds from farming with a hoe or mattock.
Make a plot of farmland with your tool and place water in the middle. Make sure the area is well lit and quite big. 
Now place crop sticks in each corner of the field. Then place the seeds on the sticks and wait a bit.
When they are fully grown you can put double crop sticks in the remaining spots by using crop sticks on already placed crop sticks.
With some luck you might get a new unknown seed which can be scanned later.
Weeds need to be removed with a trowel otherwise your field will become overgrown by them.

betterquesting.name: First Breeding
betterquesting.desc: New plants have grown on your crop sticks. You can harvest the crop by right clicking it or by left clicking with a seed bag eventually, This will destroy the plant though. Collect 8 seeds of any kind.

betterquesting.name: Weed II
betterquesting.desc:
Weeds, weeds, and more weeds. You get so many of them while cross breeding. 
Need some  biogas cells for your power production in exchange? or maybe some glowstone to light up your fields.

betterquesting.name: Unknown seeds no more
betterquesting.desc:
You have a lot of unknown seeds already. Use your scanner to scan all the seeds. 
Seeds can be planted again to breed better and more resilient crops.

betterquesting.name: Speed up your plant growth
betterquesting.desc: To speed up the growth process a bit you can use a fertilizer. You will note, however, that bone meal no longer works. A bit of ash, apatite or calcite mixed with some distilled water in a chemical reactor will give you the fertilizer you need.

betterquesting.name: Potatos, Carrots, Pumkins and Melons
betterquesting.desc:
Your seeds have three different values. growth, gain, and resistance (GGR).

The only way to change a crop's GGR without 3rd party tools is through cross breeding. When two plants cross-breed, the resulting plant will have a GGR score that is between both "parent" plants' GGR. Sometimes it will also be a little bit higher or lower. Thus, to obtain high GGR scores you must go through numerous generations of crossbreeding.

The highest score for GGR is 31.

betterquesting.name: Weed
betterquesting.desc: Weed will show up from time to time on your crop sticks. Be careful and harvest the weed with your weed trowel before the whole field becomes overgrown with them and they destroy all your plants. Later you can make some weed Ex to destroy it.

betterquesting.name: Flower Power
betterquesting.desc: Growing dyes on crops sticks? Try to plant some flowers. If you cross breed Rose and Dandelion flowers you maybe get a new flower and new dyes with different colors.

betterquesting.name: Chemical rubber production
betterquesting.desc: A much more efficient way to make insulated cables is by making molten rubber in a chemical reactor which can be applied to a cable in the assembling machine. When you put both machines next to each other you can output the molten rubber directly to the assembling machine by clicking the fluid auto-output button on the chemical reactor. Make sure to set the correct side of the reactor as output side by wrenching it.

betterquesting.name: Better than barrels
betterquesting.desc:
While barrels offer only a single slot for storage, drawers can go up to 4 slots each, 16 stacks in each slot. they can also be used to make a "ghetto ME storage system (Tec2k17)
later in the HV age with some help of ProjectRed Transportation.

betterquesting.name: Compact Drawers
betterquesting.desc: They are very compact and add some fanciness to your glorious dirt base.

betterquesting.name: Framing Drawers
betterquesting.desc: Now you can really make some swaggy and even FANCIER drawers using this table, all you have to do is place some decorative blocks (works with almost ALL decorative blocks) and it will take their texture, the TOP left is the outer Square bottom left is for the front face and top right is for the borders.

betterquesting.name: Bio Fuels
betterquesting.desc:
You are using steam, creosote, and possibly oil plus their by-products to generate Power. It's time to start with bio diesel. You can use wheat, sugarcane, apples or saplings.

Be sure you have a managed Forestry farm, Steve's Cart Farm or IC2 Crop Sticks with a harvester because you need plenty of biomaterials for constant biogas production.

Hint: Hazelnut is the ultimative source for biodiesel.

betterquesting.name: Plant balls
betterquesting.desc: The first step is to compress plantballs out of your wheat. Your LV compressor is too slow for it. I suggest crafting 4 MV compressors for the new bio diesel processing line.

betterquesting.name: Plant Mass
betterquesting.desc: Macerate the plantballs down to plant mass for better processing. In the LV and MV tiers you get only one plant mass per, in HV tier you recieve two. IV macerator gives up to four of them with a chance of 50% and 25%.

betterquesting.name: Bio Chaff
betterquesting.desc: Plant mass needs to be centrifuged into bio chaff, the base material to make biomass. You need 1 or 2 MV centrifuges to run the new production line.

betterquesting.name: Way One: IC 2 Fluid Canner
betterquesting.desc: The first way you get biomass out of bio chaff is to use the IC2 Fluid Canner. One bucket of water and one bio chaff give one bucket of biomass. In HV Tier you can use the pyrolyze oven to do it in a more efficient way.

betterquesting.name: Way Two: Brewery
betterquesting.desc: If you are lucky and find some brewing stands or familiar enough with Thaumcraft to make one you can craft a brewery. You get 750mb of biomass out of 750mb water and 1 bio chaff. In HV tier you can use the pyrolyze oven to do it in a more efficient way.

betterquesting.name: Fermented Biomass
betterquesting.desc:
With the MV fermenter you can produce fermented biomass. This is the base product to make methane, ethanol and methanol.
When you reach HV tier there's a more efficient way to process it; the distillation tower multiblock.

betterquesting.name: Can u eat those?
betterquesting.desc:
No you can't eat them but you can add them to your routed pipes. Without chips routed pipes can't do anything on their own, chips also have a GUI to configure them wich can be opened by right clicking. 
There are 8 types of chips:

-Item extractor chip can be used to send items from its inventory to responder, dynamic responder, terminator and overflow responder chips in a pipe network. 

-Item responder chip will request items from the extractor chips in your network wich match the filter configured to the inventory connected to the responder chip. Chips with higher priority value will receive items first until the inventory is full then will be sent to other inventories with valid filters and remaining space.

-Dynamic item responder chip will request items from the extractor chips in your network that match items inside the dynamic item responder connected inventory. This chip has to be in the same interface pipe as the item responder chip in order to work. Priority rules apply here as well. 

-Item overflow responder works exactly the same as the item responder chip, however it only accepts items that cannot go to an item responder chip, dynamic item responder chip, or item terminator chip. 

-Item terminator chip works as a backup for responder chips.

-Item broadcaster chip will show you the inventory connected to the routed request pipe on the pipe network and can be used to retrieve items from it. They can also extract for wich side you configure them. 

-Item stock keeper chip will constantly check the network for items and pull them to its pipe. If the chip is set to pull when empty, it will only pull if the inventory next to it is empty, otherwise it will pull when there are less items in the inventory than configured in the chip.

-Item crafting chips craft things. 

-Item crafting extension chips are placed inside the item crafting chips. Make sure you randomize the id.

betterquesting.name: Routed Pipes
betterquesting.desc:
There are six types of routed pipes: 

-Junction pipe is used to form an intersection that will allow other routed pipes to communicate. 

-Interface pipe will connect to an inventory allowing you to extract or insert items, chips can be used to control the logic. 

-Request pipe will allow requesting only specific items to be send through pipes.

-Firewall pipe can control wich items can pass through them.

betterquesting.name: Ghetto Me System
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you are familiar with the mod it's time to organize items in your base a bit. These are the things you need in order to get a basic extract/insert system.

First of all you will need a drawer controller. You can pick it from here or craft it yourself and place it down. Next to it add as much drawers as you want, and make sure they are touching each other or the controller.

The next step is to connect a routed interface pipe to your drawer controller. Take the item responder chip and configure it to filter mode: blacklist (this will allow you to get any items from your system) and add the chip to the routed interface pipe by right clicking on it. Don't forget the dynamic item responder.

In order to allow your system to be able to see items you need to add the item broadcast chip TO THE SAME ROUTED INTERFACE PIPE WICH IS CONNECTED TO THE DRAWER CONTROLLER.

The last step is to connect a routed request pipe IN THE SAME NETWORK AS THE ROUTED INTERFACE PIPE and right click it to acess the GUI. You can only extract items from it. In order to insert items simply right click them on the drawer controller. 

You can find more complex tutorials on youtube for autocrafting.

betterquesting.name: Extrude all the things
betterquesting.desc:
Now you hit the MV tier and it's time to get a better ratio when making sticks, pipes, wires, plates and many more parts. Most recipes use more than 32 EU/t so better make an MV extruder. After crafting the machine you need some extruder shapes for the different types of parts you want to make.

Most of the Tinkers Gregworks tool parts are made in the extruder.

betterquesting.name: Tool Forge
betterquesting.desc: Finally you get your first aluminum. Now it's time to craft a tool forge for making bigger Tinkers tools. A advanced bending machine is also needed.

betterquesting.name: One Block mining is so Old School
betterquesting.desc: By making a steel hammer you are now able to mine a shaft of 3x3 blocks. Be careful in the Nether or you could be boiled in lava very quickly.

betterquesting.name: Cutting a Tree log by log is so Old School
betterquesting.desc: By making a steel lumber axe you are now able to cut down the entire tree in one hit. Don't forget your backpack when you are cutting a sacred oak tree down.

betterquesting.name: Mining Dirt Block by Block is so Old School
betterquesting.desc: By making a steel excavator you are now able to mine dirt in a 3x3 area. Don't destroy your whole garden.

betterquesting.name: Glue
betterquesting.desc: If you centrifuge sticky resin, you get some glue. Glue is very useful in the creation of good circuit boards.

betterquesting.name: Silicon
betterquesting.desc: Due to the chip production silicon becomes a more important material. You can centrifuge it out of fullers earth, asbestos or redstone dust. The electric blast furnace is needed to make ingots. One ingot requires a temperature of 1687 K for 84 seconds at 120 EU/t.

betterquesting.name: Diode
betterquesting.desc: Good circuits need diodes. There are two ways to craft them. Using a silicon wafer together with some fine tin wire or gallium arsenide. Molten glass is also needed.

betterquesting.name: Empty Circuit Board
betterquesting.desc: Good circuit boards require wooden pulp and refined glue to make phenolic circuit boards. By adding gold wire you can craft a good circuit board.

betterquesting.name: Are you Prepared for HV?
betterquesting.desc:
Stainless steel will be the material for the HV Tier. There are two ways to process it. Mixing it by hand outputs 8 stainless steel dust.

Manganese can be found in ore veins together with grossular ore, spessartine ore, pyrolusite ore and tantalite ore.

Chrome can be centrifuged out of manganese dust and ruby dust.

betterquesting.name: Molten Plastic
betterquesting.desc: Molten polyethylene can be made in a chemical reactor using ethylen, compressed air cells or oxygen. Use a mold for making plates in a fluid solidifier to make plastic sheets.

betterquesting.name: Mixing Stainless Steel
betterquesting.desc:
Stainless steel will be the material for the HV Tier. There are two ways to process it. Mixing it in a mixer outputs 9 stainless steel dust each process.

Manganese can be found in ore veins together with grossular ore, spessartine ore, pyrolusite ore and tantalite ore.

Chrome can be centrifuged out of manganese dust and ruby dust.

betterquesting.name: Silicon Plate
betterquesting.desc: Advanced circuits require transistors, which are made out of silicon plates, fine tin wire and molten polyethylene.

betterquesting.name: Stainless Steel EBF processing
betterquesting.desc:
Stainless steel ingots are made in the electric blast furnace at a temperature of 1700K. 
It takes 80 seconds at 480 EU/t or by adding oxygen gas 60 seconds at 480 EU/t.

You need a miniumum of two MV energy hatches to power the EBF.

betterquesting.name: MV Energy Hatch
betterquesting.desc: Some materials like stainless steel require 480 EU/t. Your LV hatches are not good enough. Craft a minimum of two MV hatches to upgrade your electric blast furnace to HV.

betterquesting.name: Better than Duct Tape
betterquesting.desc:
A soldering iron tool to remove the burned out circuits message is better than duct tape. 
The soldering iron requires one soldering material item and 10,000 EU. Valid soldering materials are fine wires, rods, and ingots made from either tin, lead, or soldering alloy. The soldering iron will consume the first such material it finds in the player's inventory.

For the other problems other tools are necessary.

Possible problems                  Tool to fix
"Pipe is loose."                        Wrench
"Screws are missing."             Screwdriver 
"Something is stuck."               Soft mallet 
"Platings are dented."            Hammer 
"Circuitry burned out."          Soldering Iron 
"That doesn't belong there." Crowbar

betterquesting.name: Less Power loss
betterquesting.desc: When you reach MV tier you can make your own duct tape in case you have to move your multiblock machines around. Duct tape will fix all maintenance problems in any multiblock machine.

betterquesting.name: Ruby Electrolyzing
betterquesting.desc: Ruby is a good source for electrolyzing to get chrome and aluminium.  Your new MV electrolyzer gives you access to a lot of new recipes.

betterquesting.name: MV Batteries
betterquesting.desc: Better machines need some better batteries. Let's make some MV battery hulls for new batteries. Now it's up to you to make lithium, cadmium, sodium or acid batteries with these hulls.

betterquesting.name: Molten Polyethylene
betterquesting.desc:
Polyethylene is made out of ethylene in a chemical reactor.
Tip: Right-clicking an empty cell on a fluid tank will fill the cell with fluid from that tank.

betterquesting.name: Clay Electrolyzing
betterquesting.desc: You found out that electrolyzing clay dust will give you silicon dust. There are plenty of stained clay blocks found in canyon biomes or on mountains that can be pulverized to clay dust.

betterquesting.name: Powderbarrels
betterquesting.desc: Powderbarrels are twice as good as dynamite in the implosion compressor. Craft one stack.

betterquesting.name: TNT
betterquesting.desc:
TNT is much more powerful than the powderbarrel but much harder to craft. There are LV and HV ways to craft. At LV you need heavy or light fuel to make some toluene wich can be solidified to gelled toluene. Alternatively you can use sugar and plastic dust in a chemical reactor to make toluene more efficient. Mix it with sulfuric acid to make TNT.

The HV way requires an oil cracking unit to make all kinds of cracked fuel or cracked naphta and a distillation tower to extract toluene from that.

betterquesting.name: iTNT
betterquesting.desc: Industrial TNT is the HV variant of TNT. It explodes with more power, yet does not destroy blocks when it explodes.

betterquesting.name: Dynamite
betterquesting.desc:
Dynamite is the most basic explosive you can use in the implosion compressor.
Mix some paper, string and glyceryl trinitrate in a chemical reactor to get dynamite.

betterquesting.name: Time to drill!
betterquesting.desc:
Pumps are nice but you're going to reach a point where you will want MOOOOOOOOOOOOORE oil. This multiblock will help with that but you will need to search for oil using a seismic prospector. You can find raw, light and heavy oil. There's also a chance to find natural gas.

Higher tiers of power will drill faster. You need to upgrade the energy hatch coresponding to the power tier.

betterquesting.name: Let's get it crackin!
betterquesting.desc:
Cracking oil will result in better by-products in the distillation tower. It is a smart idea to get this multiblock since you are going to need TONS of industrial TNT for advanced tier rockets. 

If you add steam the amout of EU/t will be reduced by 50% and if you add hydrogen the output will be increased by 30%

betterquesting.name: Analyzing the soil
betterquesting.desc:
To determine which kind of oil or gas there is in the chunk you need to scan the soil by right clicking a seismic prospector with 8 dynamite, 4 TNT, 2 industrial TNT or 1 glyceryl. Then use a data stick to extract the data by right clicking on it after the animation has finished.
ProTip: you can do it more efficiently by only scanning every 6 chunks. 

Now you need to add the analyzed data stick to a scanner. Then place it in the bottom right slot of the printer and add 3 paper in the top left slot and make sure you have atleast 144 mb squid ink in it. (Only gregtech machines will work)

After the process is done take the printed page and combine it with a piece of leather in an assembling machine filled with at least 20 mb of refined glue. 

TADA now you have a book with info about the chunk you scanned.

betterquesting.name: You smell like a distillery!
betterquesting.desc:
This bad boy will tremendously boost the by-products of your cracked fuel by multiplying them by 5. This way you can make industrial TNT, polyethylene, polytetrafluoroethylene and other plastics more efficiently. 

You will also need this for your automated setups.

betterquesting.name: Playing with dust
betterquesting.desc: This machine will help you turn dust into crystals wich you will need for high tier recipes.

betterquesting.name: Avengers, Assemble! 2
betterquesting.desc: You know what this does. :D

betterquesting.name: Dust to crystals
betterquesting.desc: Use the autoclave to crystallize your dust. You can make raw carbon mesh out of carbon dust.

betterquesting.name: Precision is required
betterquesting.desc: You will use this a lot to make high tier circuits, and for other recipes

betterquesting.name: Way one: Raw carbon mesh
betterquesting.desc: This way of making carbon requires autoclaveing 4 carbon dust. You can use polyethylene wich gives you only 1 raw carbon fibre at LV tier, polytetrafluoroethylene gives you 2 at MV Tier or go for the best way: molten epoxid which yields 4 at HV Tier.

betterquesting.name: Way two: Bio Organic Mesh
betterquesting.desc:
If you like to save the ecosystem you can autoclave 16 plantballs to get raw bio fiber with the following liquids:

-Biomass 33% chance
-Methanol 50% chance
-Fuel 90% chance
-Nitro-diesel 100% chance

However, making carbon plates this way will require an electric blast furnace.

betterquesting.name: Carbon parts
betterquesting.desc: Those are the first parts you will need for your beloved nano armor.

betterquesting.name: Seeing things brighter
betterquesting.desc: The nano helmet is a bit special. It will provide you with night vision as long as you have energy!

betterquesting.name: Are those green diamonds?
betterquesting.desc: They may not be green diamonds but they are needed for your nano armor.

betterquesting.name: Carbon Plates
betterquesting.desc: Carbon plates are needed for the nano armor. Go check out the armor chapter.

betterquesting.name: Carbon skin
betterquesting.desc: You can stop worrying about some mobs for now. This will help you survive a bit and will give you some of that SWAG. Your journey doesn't stop here traveller, as quantum armor awaits you!

betterquesting.name: Organic Way
betterquesting.desc: Bio carbon plates are made out of raw carbon mesh. Put it in the electric blast furnace to make carbon plates.

betterquesting.name: Still not enough charcoal?
betterquesting.desc:
This oven is the best way to get charcoal and creosote (x50 faster than Railcraft's coke oven) and other byproducts. You will need tons of bronze, iron and steel to build it, but it's worth it. Finally, it will be possible to dismantle the charcoal pit.
With Cupronickel coils the oven is a bit slowlier. Each coil tier speed up the charcoal production.

betterquesting.name: Monocrystalline Silicon
betterquesting.desc: To make wafers, you need to make monocrystalline silicon first. The process takes 450 seconds and requires silicon dust and gallium arsenide dust in the electric blast furnace. You can make 16 wafers out of every boule.

betterquesting.name: We need big toys
betterquesting.desc: All your little turbines take up too much space? Are you running out of water? It is time to solve these problems. This large turbine can help you produce a tremendous amount of energy. . It will also distill water for you, so you can use the same water again inside your large boiler.  Don't forget to make a rotor for the turbine. At the initial stage the most suitable materials for the rotor are: vanadium steel (it has a very high durability, but slowly produces energy), cobalt (good combination of durability and performance) and ultimet (has higher efficiency, durability and performance).

betterquesting.name: It's time to get more steam
betterquesting.desc:
As soon as you have the ability to store energy in large quantities, it would be necessary to have a way to generate energy in large quantities. You need a large bronze boiler. But in order to make this boiler, you will need a mountain of bronze. This boiler produces 800 liters of steam per tick. This is enough to run 10 basic steam turbines.

The large boiler can uses either water or distilled water. Water is consumed at a rate of 1l of water per 150l of steam.

To make a large boiler you must make a 3x3x5 structure with pipe casings in the center of the middle 3 levels. The lowest level must contain at least 1 or 2 input hatches, 1 or 2 input buses, 3 or 4 fireboxes, 1 muffler, and one maintenance hatch. The lowest level can not contain any plated bricks. All hatches, buses, and mufflers must have their back side touching a firebox. The output hatch can be placed on any of the upper 4 levels.

betterquesting.name: Transistor
betterquesting.desc: For the next tier we need advanced circuits. To create some advanced circuits, you need some transistors.

betterquesting.name: Steam is never enough
betterquesting.desc: Now you can make advanced circuits, which means it's time to build a large steel boiler. This boiler is one and a half times more efficient than a bronze one, and that means we need 5 more steam turbines. Don't forget to monitor the water level!

betterquesting.name: Moooooore steam
betterquesting.desc: Stock up on titanium, it will be fun. A large titanium boiler produces 1600 litres of steam per tick. For this amount you need to choose the right rotors for your turbines. For example, 2 normal cobalt rotors will be just right. Optimal flow for such rotor is 800 liters per tick. If you have more than one boiler, you will need to make calculations in order to select the appropriate rotors.

betterquesting.name: Even more steam? Are you sure?
betterquesting.desc: This boiler is the most efficient source of steam. It allows you to produce as much as 2000 litres of steam per tick. If you need more, then build a dual or even quad boiler.

betterquesting.name: Energy Crystals
betterquesting.desc: Make energy crystals out of ruby and redstone dusts in the MV mixer. Energy crystals can store 1 million EU.

betterquesting.name: Nano Crystal
betterquesting.desc: Nano crystals are used for making the nano armor.

betterquesting.name: MV Precision Laser
betterquesting.desc: Advanced circuits need an MV precision laser. Let's craft one.

betterquesting.name: Silicon Wafer
betterquesting.desc: To create some silicon wafers, put the monocrystalline silicon boule in a cutting machine. It would be better to immediately make the MV version because you will need it later for RAM, IC's and other chips.

betterquesting.name: Good Integrated Circuits
betterquesting.desc: Good circuits have three variants. For the advanced circuits you need the good integrated circuits.

betterquesting.name: Integrated Circuit
betterquesting.desc: There are two variants of basic circuits. The basic circuit from IC2 or the integrated circuit which needs a circuit assembling machine to be made. The good integrated circuit needs two integrated circuits to be crafted.

betterquesting.name: Basic Circuit Assembler
betterquesting.desc: Advanced circuits require an LV circuit assembling machine. Let's make one.

betterquesting.name: Sensor lens
betterquesting.desc: The nightvision goggles need special sensor lenses to work.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Heat Exchanger
betterquesting.desc: The nightvision goggles need advanced heat exchangers to work.

betterquesting.name: Iron capped Greatwood Wand
betterquesting.desc: Making a gold capped greatwood wand requires 35 vis, but your old wand's limit is 25. So first create an iron capped greatwood wand and then create a gold capped greatwood wand.

betterquesting.name: Don't try to dive with it
betterquesting.desc: Combining a scuba helmet with a nano helmet in an assembling machine will give you a nano scuba helmet. You'd better not try to dive with it because you can't. It is a part of the new quantum suit helmet.

betterquesting.name: Plated Leggings better not try to wear it
betterquesting.desc: Combining stainless steel platings with some nano leggings in the assembler gives you nano plated leggings. Better not try to wear them because you can't. They are part of the new quantum suit leggings.

betterquesting.name: Don't try to walk with it
betterquesting.desc: Combining some rubber boots with nano boots in the Assembler gives you Nano Rubber Boots. Better not try to put them on because you can't. They are part of the new quantum suit boots.

betterquesting.name: Iridium Plated
betterquesting.desc: Plating all your armor parts with iridium alloy casings gives them a better durability. Before you can wear these quantum armor parts you need to activate them with some quantum crystals.

betterquesting.name: Quantum Armor
betterquesting.desc: The quantum armor is a high tier and very durable armor with a lot of features like night vision, fall damage reduction and running very fast.

betterquesting.name: Quantum crystal
betterquesting.desc: The quantum crystal is needed to turn quantum armor parts into wearable quantum armor.

betterquesting.name: Lapotron Dust
betterquesting.desc: Lapotron crystals require you to mix your energium dust with some lapis dust.

betterquesting.name: Lapotron Crystal
betterquesting.desc:
With your new HV mixer you can make lapotron dust. Place it in an autoclave to make some raw lapotron crystals. With an HV assembler and advanced circuits you can make some lapotron crystals wich store up to 10 million EU.

Hint: Nei shows only ic2 advanced circuits in recipe but all advanced circuits works.

betterquesting.name: Quantum Crystal
betterquesting.desc: For you quantum armor you need some quantum crystals. Place a lapotron crystal in your precision laser to get a quantum crystal

betterquesting.name: Mixing at HV Level
betterquesting.desc: High Tier dusts need HV Mixer.

betterquesting.name: NASA Workbench aka Dire Crafting Table
betterquesting.desc: The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table replaces the NASA workbench. It is required to craft all rockets and high tier equipment. First of all you need 81 crafting tables to make a double compressed crafting table, a few HV components, wafers and a crystal matrix. And yes, you do need nether stars. Hint: Check out the nether star recipe which uses null catalyst and salis mundus. Null catalyst can be duplicated by adding magma cream, blaze powder and a tiny pile of nether star dust.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Tier 1
betterquesting.desc: After hours of hard work and a few stacks of TNT your first rocket is finally ready. But before you can go to the Moon you need to craft a few more things.

betterquesting.name: Tier 1 Schematic
betterquesting.desc: Each rocket needs a construction plan. You can craft the first one using a workstation circuit and a compressed steel plate.

betterquesting.name: Tier 1 Heavy Duty Plates
betterquesting.desc: Rockets require heavy duty plates for the main hull. Let's craft 36 of these plates out of compressed aluminium plates, compressed bronze plates and compressed steel plates.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Nose Cone
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs a nose cone.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Fines
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs a few rocket fins.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Engine
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs a rocket engine. Better craft two, because the Moon lander needs one also.

betterquesting.name: Moon Lander
betterquesting.desc:
The Moon lander is requiered for a soft landing.
You will need an additional frequency module for hearing some things on planets and a second seat for a Moon buggy you may build later.

betterquesting.name: Buggy Seat
betterquesting.desc: The buggy seat is part of the Moon lander and the Moon buggy.

betterquesting.name: Frequency Module
betterquesting.desc: The frequency Module will help you hear sounds properly while in space (it's also used with the telemetry unit so that your buddies can keep track of you from your base, if you are playing with friends). You need it in you inventory and in the Moon lander.

betterquesting.name: Small Fuel Cannister
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs fuel storage cannisters. For the tier 1 rocket you need to craft two of them.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Launch Pad
betterquesting.desc: Every rocket needs a launch pad. Build a 3x3 launch pad to place your rocket on.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Fuel
betterquesting.desc: To pump fuel into your rocket you need a fuel loader. Place it right next to the middle of any side of the launch pad.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Gear
betterquesting.desc: Oxygen gear is used to attach oxygen tanks to the oxygen mask. This is absolutely vital for any astronaut.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Mask
betterquesting.desc: The oxygen mask is part of the oxygen system used to breathe on planets without oxygen, the others being oxygen gear and oxygen tanks.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Tanks
betterquesting.desc:
The Light oxygen tank is an oxygen storage tank that can hold up to 90 units of air. It is used to provide a portable source of oxygen while in areas that do not have an oxygen source of their own.

Usage:
Up to two oxygen tanks can be worn at a time. To wear any type of oxygen tank, open your inventory and click on the Galacticraft tab at the top of the menu. Here you will see the available spots for your various types of equipment. Simply place your tank(s) in one of the slots with a grey picture of an oxygen tank. Other types of oxygen tanks are the medium oxygen tank, which holds twice the amount of oxygen as a light tank, and the heavy oxygen tank, which holds three times the amount of a light tank.

betterquesting.name: Copper Ore
betterquesting.desc: Can be found between y levels 5 and 60 either as "Copper Ore" or "Chalcopyrite". Most of the time you'll find it together with  "Iron" and "Pyrite".

betterquesting.name: Iron Ore
betterquesting.desc: With iron tools, you are able to mine most of the Overworld ores. I think you already found iron or magnetite. So bring me some ores and make some iron ingots out of them.

betterquesting.name: Rocket Fuel
betterquesting.desc: For every flight the rocket needs some fuel. So refine some fuel and fill some fuel cannisters.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Collector
betterquesting.desc: The oxygen collector is a block that gathers oxygen from leaves and farm plants to use in an oxygen bubble distributor, oxygen sealer, oxygen compressor, and other oxygen-reliant machines. If you plan to build a Moon base, which needs a continuous oxygen supply, you will need to build one.

betterquesting.name: Oxygen Compressor
betterquesting.desc: The oxygen compressor is used to fill empty or depleted oxygen tanks. Connect an oxygen pipe to the blue ring input side and a power source to the grey square input side. Place an oxygen tank in the bottom right slot and it will take oxygen from the input and place it into the tank.

betterquesting.name: Parachute
betterquesting.desc: A parachute is used to prevent death upon re-entry into the Overworld's atmosphere. The parachute is an essential part of your journey to space. You should never journey into space without it. There will even be a warning if you try to launch without one on you.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Wafers
betterquesting.desc: The advanced wafer is used for more advanced machines such as the advanced solar panel or the avaritia dire crafting table. It is also used in the creation of a space station.

betterquesting.name: Wafers
betterquesting.desc: The basic wafer is used for creating basic machines such as the basic solar panel, the fuel loader, the energy storage module and the compressor.

betterquesting.name: Purge your warp
betterquesting.desc: The warp you have accumulated over time is starting to become a problem. Making bath salts to clean off the warp is only a temporary solution. To truly get rid of it, you need something more powerful, a pure tear. If you collect a few things for me, I will give you one. Think wisely about using it, since it's a very long journey to unlock it through research.

betterquesting.name: Circuit Boards
betterquesting.desc: For every circuit you need a basic circuit board. Craft a coated circuit board and use copper wire to finish it.

betterquesting.name: Resistor
betterquesting.desc: Every basic circuit needs two resistors to work

betterquesting.name: Gallium Arsenide
betterquesting.desc:
The diode requires gallium arsenide and you may be wondering how to get gallium or arsenic this early in the game.
You can get gallium out of crushed zinc ore by using a thermal centrifuge. You can find the small zinc ores in the Overworld or the in the Nether at Y Level 80 - 210. To get cushed ore, you may need a Tinker's Construct tool with the Luck (Fortune) enchant on it. Sphalerite is another source of gallium.
You can get arsenic from realgar small ores in the Nether at Y level 5 - 85. Centrifuge the dusts in a centrifuge. Another source is tinkers construct cobalt ore in the nether.
Mix those two dusts in a mixer to get gallium arsenic dust.

betterquesting.name: ILC and RAM
betterquesting.desc:
Advanced circuits need itegrated logic circuits and random access memory chips.
You can get those by cutting the ILC and RAM wafers.

betterquesting.name: Advanced Circuits
betterquesting.desc: For the next tier we need advanced circuits. To make an advanced circuit, you need good integrated circuits, RAM, an ILC and transistors.

betterquesting.name: Handle tiny piles like a K1ng
betterquesting.desc: Don't you hate to manually compress all those tiny piles ? Well, let me show you how to automate that. A combination of typefilter, chest buffer (or super buffer in HV) and packager frees you from that annoying task. The chestbuffer can hold up to 9 stacks of tiny piles and the super buffer can hold 256 stacks of tiny dusts, which is more than enough. You can set its mode with a screwdriver on the output side. Set it to 9 to export 9 tiny piles at a time and let the packager compress these into regular dusts.

betterquesting.name: Butane and Propane
betterquesting.desc:
You can distill a lot of different gases out of your "refinery gases".
Methane, butane, propane, helium and ethane.

Hint:
Refinery gas is not the best source for Propane and Butane. Better refine those out of naphtha.

betterquesting.name: Tetranitromethane
betterquesting.desc: Light fuel, bio diesel and diesel can be boosted by using tetranitromethane. Ethenone and nitric acid are required to make tetranitromethane in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: Methane Gas
betterquesting.desc: Methane gas with a burn value of 104,000 EU per cell can be burned in the gas turbine.

betterquesting.name: Methanol
betterquesting.desc: Methanol with a burn value of 84,000 EU per cell can be used to make biodiesel and other fluids.

betterquesting.name: Ethanol
betterquesting.desc: Ethanol with a burn value of 192,000 EU per cell can be used to make biodiesel and other fluids.

betterquesting.name: Bio Diesel Fuel
betterquesting.desc:
With ethanol or methanol and seedoil or fish oil you can make bio diesel. Burn value is 256,000 EU per cell. Diesel and bio diesel are needed for cetane-boosted diesel.

You get some glycerol as by-product. Save it so you can make glyceryl trinitrate for your dynamite.

betterquesting.name: O like Oxygen
betterquesting.desc: Oxygen can be made in different ways. Centrifuge some brown an yellow lemonite dust, or electrolyze it out of water or various other oxygen-rich elements.

betterquesting.name: Ethylene
betterquesting.desc: You can make ethylene out of ethanol and sulfuric acid in a chemical reactor or by distilling various gases (i.e. wood gas) in a distillery. Cracking naptha, fuels and gas with hydrogen or steam in the chemical reactor will work too.

betterquesting.name: Seed Oil
betterquesting.desc: To make some bio diesel you need seed oil or fish oil and mix that with ethanol or methanol. Seeds give seed oil when placed in a fluid extractor.

betterquesting.name: Sodium Hydroxide
betterquesting.desc:
Make some sodium hydroxide. You can make it out of sodium (or out of salt water once you reach EV).

The by-product hydrogen can be burned in a gas turbine.

betterquesting.name: Ethenone
betterquesting.desc:
Hopefully you saved some sulfuric acid during your fuel production. Together with acetic acid you can make ethenone.
Craft an advanced chemical reactor to get access to more advanced recipes.

betterquesting.name: Nitric Acid
betterquesting.desc: Nitric acid can be made out of water, oxygen and nitrogen dioxide.

betterquesting.name: Acetic Acid
betterquesting.desc: Acetic acid can be made out of oxygen and ethylene. Alternatively, it can be made out of biomass, wood vinegar or vinegar.

betterquesting.name: Nitrogen Dioxide
betterquesting.desc: To make nitrogen dioxide you need to combine oxygen gas and nitric oxide in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: Ammonia
betterquesting.desc: Nitrogen and hydrogen... Ammonia.

betterquesting.name: Nitric Oxide
betterquesting.desc: To make nitric oxide you need to combine oxygen and ammonia in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: 1,1-Dimetylhydrazine
betterquesting.desc: To make 1,1-dimethylhydrazine you need to combine some dimethylamine and chloramine in a chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: Dimethylamine
betterquesting.desc: Combining ammonia and methanol in a chemical reactor produces some dimethylamine.

betterquesting.name: Chloramine
betterquesting.desc: Combining hypochlorous acid and ammonia in a chemical reactor produces some chloramine.

betterquesting.name: Hypochlorous Acid
betterquesting.desc: Hypochlorous acid requires water, chlorine and some mercury.

betterquesting.name: Titanium finaly
betterquesting.desc:
Rutile, chlorine and carbon dust makes Titaniumtetrachloride. Combining this with Magnesium in an HV EBF will give you hot Titanium ingots. Freeze those and you will get your first titanium.
On Mars you can find pure Titanium ore.

betterquesting.name: Tungstensteel
betterquesting.desc: Tungstensteel is needed for the next tier. Tungsten can be found on Mars or in Moon stone dust. Mix that with some steel dust. Smelt it at 3000K (requires nichrome coils) in an electric blast furnace.

betterquesting.name: Your first bone bow
betterquesting.desc:
Since vanilla bows are only craftable in the assembling machine and mobs do not drop them very often you have to make a Tinkers bow. You could make it out of wood but bone would be much better. So craft the bow limbs out of bone and the bow string out of strings. The arrow that has the most durability is bone flint. It is much lighter but less durable than a regular arrow.

You can repair your bow the same way as all the other Tinkers tools. Arrows can be regained by repairing them or picking them up from the floor.

betterquesting.name: Bronze javelin
betterquesting.desc: The bronze javelin is a bit expensive and has only 7 throws, yet it is a good mid-range weapon. With one bronze ingot you can replenish your stack of javelins.

betterquesting.name: Your first flint throwing knife
betterquesting.desc: Is the bone bow too expensive for your taste? Then make a flint throwing knife instead. You need flint and a stick to get 12 knives. The durability and the attack damage are very low but it still helps with killing mobs from a safe distance.

betterquesting.name: Monster trap
betterquesting.desc: If you're lucky you spawn in a sand or rainforest biome and find some quicksand. Collect a stack of the stuff, dig a small ditch and fill it with the quicksand to protect your "dirt base" home.

betterquesting.name: The transcontinental railroad
betterquesting.desc: All the different mining veins that have been found seem to be really far apart. One way to shorten the travel time is to create a railroad from your base to the different mines. Sadly this requires a large amount of both iron and creosote. Let's not forget to place the last symbolic rivet on one of your new train lines.

betterquesting.name: Lapis, Lazurite, Sodalite, Calcite
betterquesting.desc:
In order to make your bricked blast furnace you need to find a lapis vine containing calcite.
You can find the vein in the overworld or the Twilight Forest at Y 20-50.

betterquesting.name: Gypsum
betterquesting.desc: To make bricks for the blast furnace you need concrete and gypsum. Gypsum can be found in a vein together with basaltic and granitic mineral sand, and fullers earth. Y 50-60 and only in the overworld.

betterquesting.name: Sifting Machine
betterquesting.desc: You need flawless or exquisite diamonds, emeralds, rubies or other gems? Well then it's time for you to make a Sifting Machine.

betterquesting.name: Smelt all the things...
betterquesting.desc:
Smelting up to nine items at once? With a bit of steel you can make a railcraft Steam Oven. 2x2x2

Hint: All furnace recipes work just fine, but you cannot use it to make charcoal from wood.

betterquesting.name: Molds, molds, molds
betterquesting.desc: After you can make steel and have a tinkers smelter you have to make molds. Molds can be used in the alloy smelter and the fluid solidifier. You need them to make vacuum tubes, ingots, gears and more.

betterquesting.name: Maple Syrup
betterquesting.desc: You spent hours and hours to find some maple trees? Why not use your forest ranger coins to buy some syrup? Add some spruce saplings and plant some maple trees.

betterquesting.name: Seed Bags
betterquesting.desc: Finding some special "pams harvest craft" seeds can be very difficult. With your farmer coins you can buy some seedbags.

betterquesting.name: Jetpack v.0.1 Alpha
betterquesting.desc: Do you like flying? Ok then, make a slimy bouncepad and enjoy the good view.

betterquesting.name: Slime Island Journey
betterquesting.desc:
Rubber trees are not the only source for raw rubber. Go and find a slimy island high in the sky. Slime balls and slime leaves give raw rubber too.
Make some slime tree farms beside your rubber farm.

betterquesting.name: Iron berry bush
betterquesting.desc: Farming your iron (berries) instead of finding iron ores.

betterquesting.name: Gold berry bush
betterquesting.desc: Farming your gold (berries) instead of finding gold ore.

betterquesting.name: Copper berry bush
betterquesting.desc: Farming your copper (berries) instead of finding copper ore.

betterquesting.name: Aluminum berry bush
betterquesting.desc: Farming your Aluminum (berries) instead of looking for aluminum gravel.

betterquesting.name: Witch
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. What's cooking?

betterquesting.name: Pigmen
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Do you want some bacon?

betterquesting.name: Blaze
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Let me warm you up a bit.

betterquesting.name: Magma Cube
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely, and bouncy.

betterquesting.name: Enderman
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Don't look me in the eyes!

betterquesting.name: Cave Spider
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Let me sing itsy-bitsy spider for you.

betterquesting.name: Ghast
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. At least you're not a big cry-baby?

betterquesting.name: Tin berry bush
betterquesting.desc: Farming your tin (berries) instead of finding tin ore.

betterquesting.name: Silverfish
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Let me be as annoying as possible.

betterquesting.name: Magma Cube
betterquesting.desc: You feel lonely. Wanna bounce?

betterquesting.name: Better Tank... ULV Tank
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 32 buckets in a tank. The ULV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, iron plates, tin plates a clay pipe and a water bucket.

betterquesting.name: Better Tank... LV Tank
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 64 buckets in a tank. The LV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, iron plates, bronze plates a huge clay pipe and an LV pump.

betterquesting.name: Better Tank... MV Tank
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 128 buckets in a tank. The MV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, darksteel plates, bronze plates a  bronze pipe and an LV pump.

betterquesting.name: You're gonna hate this #2 in MV too
betterquesting.desc:
The second item you'll need a lot of in MV tier. When you want to get fluid out of tanks you'll need one. 

Hint: Goes pretty well with fluid pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver. It can also be upgraded further into a fluid regulator which allows precise control of fluid transfer speed.

betterquesting.name: Better Tank... HV Tank
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 256 buckets in a tank. The HV Tank from Gt++ needs aluminium plates, darksteel plates, vacuum tubes a  steel pipe and an MV pump.

betterquesting.name: You're gonna hate this #1 in MV too
betterquesting.desc:
The first item you'll need a lot of in MV too. If you want to pull items out of chests or barrels you'll need one. 

Hint: Goes pretty well with item pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver.

betterquesting.name: You're gonna hate this #3 in MV too
betterquesting.desc: An electric piston for your MV machines. The third item you are going to craft a lot of in the future.

betterquesting.name: You're gonna hate this #4 in MV too
betterquesting.desc:
The fourth item you'll need a lot of in MV, which is also a pain to craft. Arguably the most painful item ever. 

Hint: Works like a conveyor but can work with selected item slots. Adjust with a screwdriver.

betterquesting.name: Simple Ore Washer
betterquesting.desc: Too lazy to make an ore washer, yet bored with your non-automatable cauldron? Then the simple washer is the machine for you! It work reasonably fast and uses 8eu max. Ok, you do not get any byproducts, but who cares!

betterquesting.name: Paying the highest price
betterquesting.desc: A tier 2 blood altar needs 8 runes placed around the altar. Your new altar can hold more blood.

betterquesting.name: Don't look it in the eyes!
betterquesting.desc: Bad things may happen if this creature is allowed to stay alive. The ores in its cave are valuable anyway.

betterquesting.name: I don't even...
betterquesting.desc: Ok so there is this maze. And there are... minotaurs. But what in the world is a minoshroom?

betterquesting.name: A big ugly snake
betterquesting.desc: Required for your first wand and in general, an ugly creature.

betterquesting.name: Adventure time!
betterquesting.desc: Stop him before he makes his wish at Prismos'!

betterquesting.name: Who you're gonna call?
betterquesting.desc: Phantom Busters! Or wait... Ah whatever. They drop good armor by the way.

betterquesting.name: The big fluffy crybaby
betterquesting.desc: It flies, it makes funny sounds, and .. IT'S SO FLUFFY! Well, kill it.

betterquesting.name: Let her go
betterquesting.desc: It seems the cold doesn't bother her. Committed crimes: None. But... you know... you have to progress somehow...

betterquesting.name: Yeti. Alpha, Yeti.
betterquesting.desc: Wanted: Alpha Yeti. Death. Committed crimes: Violently throwing ice at people, for no reason.

betterquesting.name: Secret: A nice....
betterquesting.desc: Hey, you! I want that lamp. I have something for you in return. You don't need it anyways, do you?

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Creeper)
betterquesting.desc: Who hasn't experienced this... You think nothing evil, mine a few diamonds, and suddenly, you wake up in your bed, all your items gone. Time to strike back!

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Pigman)
betterquesting.desc: "Zombie Pigman"? What the hell is going on with you zombies! Maybe you should encase your animals better at night...

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Spiders)
betterquesting.desc: Eeeek! Wall climbing monsters, gross! Slay them. Quickly!

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Skeleton)
betterquesting.desc:
Arrows are nice, if you shoot them. If one hits you, well, bad things happen. 

Hint: Arrows are an excellent source of telum.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Blaze)
betterquesting.desc: You should be careful with this task. Fire protection is highly recommended.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Zombie)
betterquesting.desc: Nobody knows who they are, or where they came from. They're just annoying at night, and too stupid to make a crafting table.

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Enderman)
betterquesting.desc: Uh, fancy teleport pearls. You need them. All of them. Now!

betterquesting.name: Time to kill (Wither)
betterquesting.desc: After collecting a couple of those wither skeleton heads, you feel like you could need some more action. So why not kill a wither? You'll need a ton of nether stars anyway...

betterquesting.name: Secret: The trade for life
betterquesting.desc: You have been busy my friend. I have something for you. Give me your hearts, and I will magically enhance them so you can actually use those.

betterquesting.name: Skeleton: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: In order to advance to a higher tier and reach Mars, Deimos and Phobos, you need to make yourself a better rocket. There are rumors, that an evolved skeleton has schematics of such a device.

betterquesting.name: Creeper: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: Not that regular creepers are nasty enough, no. There is an evolved creeper boss! He is your key (Well he HAS a key...) to reach the next tier of planets (Asteroid Belt, Ceres, Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto).

betterquesting.name: Blaze: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: In order to proceed to Tier 4 Planets, the blaze boss needs to be killed. Find him in one of the dungeons on Ceres.

betterquesting.name: Ghast: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: Fluffy, fluffier, ghasts! And also big crybabies. This one hides in a dungeon on IO, and holds the key for Tier 5 planets.

betterquesting.name: Crystal Boss: Ayyy.. Wait, what?
betterquesting.desc: Seriously, a crystal boss? Anyway, it's your key to Tier 6 planets, and he lurks around on Enceladus.

betterquesting.name: Slime: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: Totally looks like a thaumic slime to me. Don't you think so? Find this dude on Proteus.

betterquesting.name: Wolf:Evolved
betterquesting.desc: The final frontier... A... wolf that is not even an Iron Maiden fan?... What did you expect, a super boss? Heh. No. Budget was too tight...

betterquesting.name: Technology: Evolved
betterquesting.desc: You beat the game, literally. There is nothing left to do, you might want to try real life... But one thing might be interesting for you. You know, just for the phuns. Select one of the totally OP items here.

betterquesting.name: Blood Altar Tier 3
betterquesting.desc: To make your altar more powerfull you need to upgrade it. You need to build pillars two block high out of blood-soaked thaumium block and on top one block of glowstone blocks on each pillar.

betterquesting.name: Blood Altar Tier 4
betterquesting.desc: If you want to make tier 4 slates you need a Tier 4 altar. This can be made like the tier 3 altar with pillars out of void-blood-soaked stones four blocks high and a blood brick on top the pillars.

betterquesting.name: Blood Altar Tier 5
betterquesting.desc: If you want to make tier 5 slates you need a Tier 5 altar. This can be made with 4 beacons. Beacons have thaumcraft recipes and can be found in the thaumcraft book on the GTNH page.

betterquesting.name: Blood Altar Tier 6
betterquesting.desc: The highest tier of the blood altar is tier 6. You need pillars of blood-soaked ichorium 7 blocks high and on top the crystal cluster blocks out of demon souls shards.

betterquesting.name: Auto Mining
betterquesting.desc: A miner in LV age? Wow! This nifty machine will find ores for you. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This machine needs 32 EU/t to work; with an 8V Solar panel it works at 25% speed. The miner searches for ores in a 16 block radius.

betterquesting.name: Auto Mining MV
betterquesting.desc: The MV miner will find ores for you better than the LV miner. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This miner need 128 eu to work. The Miner searches ores in a 24 block radius and works two times faster than the LV variant.

betterquesting.name: Auto Mining HV
betterquesting.desc: The HV miner will find ores fore you better than the MV miner. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This miner needs 512 eu to work. The Miner searches ores in a 32 block radius (two chuncks) and works two times faster than the MV variant.

betterquesting.name: Power of the Sun
betterquesting.desc: Now its time to investigate in some regenerative engery. Let's start with solarpanels. The basic one only gives 1 EU/t. Most gt machine can use them as covers.

betterquesting.name: Power of the Sun 8V
betterquesting.desc: The next solarpanel you can make is the ULV one. It generates 8 EU/t. Most gt machine can use them as covers.

betterquesting.name: Power of the Sun 1x1
betterquesting.desc: Put those single eu panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with a ULV hull.

betterquesting.name: Power of the Sun at LV Level
betterquesting.desc: The next solarpanel you can make is the LV one. It generates 32 EU/t max. Most gt machine can use them as covers. First you need to produce a sunnarium item by using 10 million eu power.

betterquesting.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 LV
betterquesting.desc: Put those 32 eu panel on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with an LV hull.

betterquesting.name: Automated Sticky Resin Farmer
betterquesting.desc: If you are tired of crafting tons of tree taps, how about a machine that uses power but never breaks? Let's craft an electric tree tap.

betterquesting.name: Automated Farmer
betterquesting.desc: Your hoe must be getting worn out by now. Why not craft an electric one which never breaks.

betterquesting.name: Cleanroom
betterquesting.desc:
If you want to make more advanced circuits you need a cleanroom. The cleanroom is a multiblock between 3x4x3 and 15x15x15 (WxHxDx) blocks. Besides plascrete blocks you need a controller, filter casings on the top, an energy and maintenance hatch , a reinforced door and three machine hulls. For now you can use MV tier.

Let's build a 5x5x5 room.

betterquesting.name: A very useful Scanner
betterquesting.desc:
The portable scanner is a tool capable of showing advanced information about almost every block in the game. 
In order to function, the tool needs to be charged first. It can hold up to 400k EU and accept 128 EU/t or less. This is MV tier.

It can scan crops, which shows more information than the cropnalyzer does. The crop, which was scanned in the world, will drop a scanned seed bag.
It can scan machines from GregTech, giving information about current progress, the stored energy, efficiency, problems and CPU-load.
For any block in the game it scans, it gives information about its ID, Metadata, position in the world and hardness value.
It also gives information about pollution level in the chunk the scanned block belongs to.
Additional to that it shows when the clenroom has reached his 100% efficeny level.

betterquesting.name: The Plunger
betterquesting.desc:
The Plunger can be used to clear liquids from pipes. It can also be used on a machine to remove up to 1000mb of fluid from its internal buffer. You don't have to wrench your machine and replace it. It can be crafted from a rod of the desired material and rubber sheets. 

Hint: Plunger deals 2.75 - 7.75 damage depending on the materials used.

betterquesting.name: Performing chemical experiments at HV Level
betterquesting.desc: High tier chemical recipes like ammonia need an HV chemical reactor.

betterquesting.name: Super Tank I
betterquesting.desc: Next step is to store 40000 buckets in a tank. The super tank needs a hermetic casing made with aluminium plates and PTFE pipe. The tank need 4 circuits, a pulsatingiron  plates and an MV pump. Now you can store the exact amount of fluids a steel 5x5 steel tank contains.

betterquesting.name: Chad a better way to make Paper
betterquesting.desc: Making paper out of wood pulp and water can be tedious and difficult. Why not using some sugar cane macerate it down to chad and press it with two stone plates to paper? Later on you can use the chemical bath for a even better ratio.

betterquesting.name: Baboo fence
betterquesting.desc: Maybe you are lucky and start in a bomboo wood. Bamboo is very usefull the trees growing realy fast and when you place bomboo sticks it will grow and protec your base behind a 3 bocks high wall. Alternative you can use berry bushe too.

betterquesting.name: Punji Sticks
betterquesting.desc: A early game protection fence can mada out of punji sticks. It hurts all mobs/players and add give slowness II potion effect. Making a trench around your base and put the punji sticks inside.

betterquesting.name: Better than iron
betterquesting.desc:
Wrought Iron will become very soon more important when you have a bit steel and able to build high pressure steam machines. The material is much harder then iron and you can make better tools with it too.
To make wrought Iron you need a furnace to smelt iron ingots down to wrough iron nuggets. With the compressor you can compress the nuggets to ingots.

Hint:
Crushed or purified oredust can be smelt to iron nuggets directly.

betterquesting.name: Garden Bags
betterquesting.desc: Finding some special "pams harvest craft" gardens can be very difficult. With your farmer coins you can buy some gardenbags.

betterquesting.name: XP berry bush
betterquesting.desc: Farming your XP instead of harming monsters or aninmals.

betterquesting.name: Fluid Solidifier
betterquesting.desc: Use molds to make plates, sticks, bolts and many more item parts in the fluid solidifier.

betterquesting.name: Base too big? I've got a fix for you!
betterquesting.desc: Keeping a base spread apart for pollution or explosion prevention can really wear you out. Try harvesting some Marble and centrifuging it into Calcite, and mix up some concrete in your Mixer. Next output it into a Fluid Solidifier to make concrete blocks. You'll move faster on top of these blocks. They can even be turned into bricks to prevent unwanted spawns! Hint: 10 buckets of wet mix converts to exactly 160 blocks. Note: Don't stack blocks more than 1 high or else you might move faster than you'd like. Or do it if you need to really get from point A to point B in a hurry. Also keep your animals off them.

betterquesting.name: Stainless Steel Pipes
betterquesting.desc: Stainless steel pipes are much better than steel pipes. Like all high tier pipes (Titanium, Tungstensteel etc) you need a better wrench to deconstruct the pipes.

betterquesting.name: The "Waterproblems" are solved
betterquesting.desc: Entering the HV age you found a way of making a water reservoir wich solves the finite water problem. Craft it with some fused quartz glass, HV pumps and cauldrons.

betterquesting.name: Piston
betterquesting.desc: Want some pistons? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Piston LV
betterquesting.desc: Want some LV pistons? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Motor LV
betterquesting.desc: Want some LV motors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Pump LV
betterquesting.desc: Want some LV pumps? Buy some!

betterquesting.desc: Want some LV conveyor belts? Buy some!

betterquesting.desc: Want some LV robot arms? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Sensor LV
betterquesting.desc: Want some LV sensors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Emitter LV
betterquesting.desc: Want some LV emitters? Buy some!

betterquesting.desc: Want some basic circuit boards? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Good Circuit Board
betterquesting.desc: Want some good circuit boards? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Vacuum Tubes
betterquesting.desc: Want some vacuum tubes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Resistors
betterquesting.desc: Want some resistors? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Diodes
betterquesting.desc: Want some diodes? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Wafers
betterquesting.desc: Want some wafers? Buy some!

betterquesting.name: Transistors
betterquesting.desc: Want some transistor? Buy some!
